Not the most exciting thing you'll do in Austin, but it's free, interesting, and air conditioned, so why not?! Check out the gift shop and tiny O Henry museum (a single room, but still well done) downstairs, and go upstairs for an interactive kids' area and some more information about how white people settled in Texas.
Wonderful building with lots of Texas history.  Worth a look. Took the guided capital tour. Its FREE.
Fantastic place at night love the way it's lit up

Wonderful stop for a quick visit, (but if you're in a hurry, then skip it).  Informative & little museum on the 2nd floor provides the history of the State Capitol building.  A neat little gift shop, and travel center with brochures for all of Texas.  (Restrooms too.) No food or drink allowed.  Great place to cool down too!

name: Twin Falls
reviews: Fun hike with a couple of falls when there is water but ours was dry.  It's pretty rocky but our 3.5 year old was able to do it with help.
It was dry when we hiked (3/11/20) but it was enjoyable especially because the weather was cool. Michael's Tree was a great stop.

Water is good to bath only during spring/fall and is seasonal. During summers its very dry n pond looks dirty with stagnant water.
Good place to place with family/dogs
Relaxing hike. On the short side of things, but you could make it longer if needed. Shaded most of the way. Dry bed in winter. We would come back.

Had a lot of fun out here with the pups! Barton Creek is mostly dried up this time of year so we walked the creek bed which can be a little slippery after a sprinkle so be careful. Definitely a recommended trail if you haven’t been before. It’s even better when the waters back so you’ll want to return in the spring time for both experiences

name: Statesman Bat Observation Center
address: 305 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: A must see! I can’t believe that many bats came rushing out from under the bridge! They just kept coming! Also what a beautiful sunset.
It's a pretty neat experience to see all the bats come out and circle around. There are hundreds of bats.

If you get there early enough, you can get your very own stone to sit on. 
You’d think that for all the people who turn out every night that the city would provide some proper seating.
The bats are amazing.

Wow! Such a neat experience. There are so many different vantage points to enjoy the bats coming out from the bridge and the scenery is amazing with the skyscrapers and the water. There were an incredible amount of bats flying everywhere!

It is quite a unique thing to see millions of bats flying around in a single area! You need to be down there after sunset to see them, but they will always emerge. Sometimes if it is too hot out, it can be hours before they finally come out. They are down in Mexico for the fall and winter, so certain times a year it's not something you want to try and do as you'll be staring for hours without a single bat passing by. Definitely recommend taking the kids, or a date down here! Bring a blanket, bug spray, some drinks, and some snacks and you will have fun!

name: Haunted ATX
address: 501 N Interstate Hwy 35, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews: The wife and I had a great time. Got this as an anniversary gift for the wifey and myself. Had a blast. Our tour guide, Jane, was awesome. Keeps you captivated with the haunted stories, with just enough comedy to break the ice. Would recommend for anybody new to the area, or wants a tour of some of the haunted history of Austin.

My wife and I did the herst tour with Diane for our anniversary and it was so much fun. We loved  visiting all the placing and learning a little bit of history and having lots of laughs. She was such a great tour guide and made our trip memorable

I surprised my family and friends with a night off the beaten path! Super cool creepy night!!! This guy scheduled plenty of spots for us and filled the night with all the spooky stories!!! The night starts with a scheduled pickup in a hurst and your off. The event is reasonably priced room enough for our group of six.

A group of us did this tour in their 12 passenger van. Our tour guide was amazing! She was very knowledgeable and did a great job of giving the history and facts behind all the locations we visited. The tour gained us access to some cool places that we would've never been able to see otherwise. BYOB in the van is a nice touch and the van was in very good condition and fit 11 of us pretty comfortably. Definitely worth the time and money to check out this tour!

I took my brother on a private hearse tour and we had the big white hearse and Diane. Both were fabulous and it was SO fun to have an entire hearse (that carried MANY bodies in its heyday) to ourselves. I knew it was BYOB but Diane had a bucket of ice, water and sodas for us which was a lovely touch.

We were picked up at our restaurant and dropped off at our hotel, in between visiting four haunted places. Thankfully, the tour itself wasn't TOO creepy (though you bet I kept looking at mirrors) but it was chock full of history, actual images from the places we visited with hauntings and packed with personality as Diane was SO great. 

I can't recommend this tour enough and throw in a few extra bucks for the hearse, trust me!

name: Red Bud Isle
reviews: Being not far from the downtown Austin and one of the rare islands on Lake Austin, Red Bud Isle is quiet and nice place to spend an hour or two. It is dog friendly, but even if you don't have a dog, you will enjoy. Parking is very limited,  less than 20 card at a time, so be prepared to wait, or come by bike or walk to here. There are many bald cypresses and fee red bud trees which bloom right now from end of February to mid March. In summer might be too hot and the swimming is not allowed.

Nice little idyllic spot to chill with my dog. The fishing is not great here, but it's always relaxing so I keep coming back. It's off-leash, and most dogs we encounter here are well socialized. I rarely hear any scuffles going on.
Excellent place to take the dogs off leash. No need to worry about them going anywhere because the park is surrounded by water!

A gorgeous place to take your dogs for a walk  offleash!!
Very clean and fun for hiking!! 
This is by far my favorite dog park!!
Parking is a bit tight, but it's really worth it!!
Outstanding off leash dog park. Parking spots can be hard to come by though.

name: Before I Die Wall Austin TX
address: 206 E Elizabeth St, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: Super cool mural that you add your own goals and dreams to. It's a little off the beaten path but well work it. The plant is right in front of the mural. The house is next door but also really cool!
Novality idea in S. Austin. It literally is on the back of someone's garage in a residential neighborhood. GPS got us there just fine. Fun.

Its cool, but trees in the way if you have a huge group. We went and wrote as small as we could fit all of the dreams. They have chalk for you there to be able to write on the wall. Its so cute! What will you do before you die!

This ATX community prize is a great idea, and I am glad that the idea is a reality where people can dream! You can take the wife, girlfriend, kids, or go at it alone like in the shower!  Just be sure to read others dreams and wishes and respect everyone as you write your deepest secrets or some brash fantasy involving whip cream and 2 brunettes! Either way enjoy it and remember kids visit this ATX community to do the same with chalk!
Top 50 things to do in austin, local home owner put up a before I do chalk board and it's really cool to add your own to it for others to see

name: Capital Cruises
address: 208 Barton Springs Rd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: This was a a wonderful cruise. Our guide was very informative. Beautiful Austin skyline on one side and the park on the other side. Great to view bats under the bridge (unfortunately January is not month for Bat viewing since most of them fly to Mexico). Reservation highly recommended as tours can get full quickly.

Great tour guide and great experience! Every tour guide is different and ours had a lot of fun facts and knowledge about the bats and the surrounding area. Amazing view of the bats especially during the warmer months when they venture out further. I'll definitely be going again soon!
Took the Bat Watching Cruise. It was great weather and the operator of our boat was informative and entertaining. I really enjoyed the whole cruise in Lady Bird Lake.
Beck was incredibly informative and funny! Could not have chosen a better company to go with!! The bats were an incredible sight, really worth going, plus we saw a generous amount of other birds too.

Had a great time with my wife and children on this bat viewing excursion. We had fun, and yes, we saw bats, lots of them!
Our tour guide Georgia was awesome. She shared so much info about the city, and her passion was authentic Austin, not some imitator looking for a pay check. She even suggested some local restaurants for us to try after the tour. 

I suggest you have reasonable expectations during this outing, the bats do what they want to do when they want to do it. There was one customer with the most sour of attitudes, first off she was about the size of the boat, and her poor husband looked ashamed of her obnoxiousness. Poor guy. 

We saw this swan before the sun went down. Had a great time.

(Edit typo)

name: Escapology Escape Rooms Austin
address: 2000 S, I-35 Ste E2, Round Rock, TX 78681, USA
reviews: Amazing experience, I design puzzles as part of a hobby but this was still a fantastic challenge. Reasonable priced, and even accommodated my walk in. Devin was very knowledgeable and nice even when she came to tell us we failed and drowned in the submarine. 6/5 stars. I will be back to try the other rooms!!!!

We recently tried the Assassination Express escape room w/our son, daughter in law & her mom. We weren't sure about doing this adventure but our family swore it would be fun. They were right! We had one hour to solve a mystery and escape the room. Lo and behold it took us 57 minutes & 46 seconds to save FDR in 1932. We loved the escape room and highly recommend it to anyone! Our Game Master and Escapologist, Christopher Ambriz, was a great guide into our time travel mystery adventure. Make sure to bring family & friends as it's more fun with a group. Escapology is worthy of it's 5 star Yelp review.

My friend recently planned a girls night for me to celebrate my birthday and this was my favorite part of the night. We enjoyed the Nuclear Annihilation room! The whole thing was well thought out, professional quality and full of surprises. The staff there that night explained what to do and not to do in a very clear and friendly way. We will all be returning to try the other rooms!

I took my team to this great escape room, 17 people, college educated folks, some with engineering background, some with language background. They all loved it. We were split into 3 rooms, a virus theme, a nuclear theme and an assassin theme. All teams completed their challenge on time and had to really work together to make it happen. Fun!
Amaizing place! its worthy to spend time with your friends and family members, they providing 4 different themes with diffrent difficulty levels and the stuff are very kind & cooperative.

name: Visit Austin
address: 111 Congress Ave Suite 700, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: To Travel to Austin, Texas is worth your while because of its awesome location, unique weather, and enjoyable activities. When it comes to weather in Austin, You either have very hot weather or very cold weather. There are many places you can visit in Austin. You can visit Barton creek where you could swim for the whole day, the Alamo, a little south of Austin, and not only can you see some of the many lakes in Texas, but you can also go boating on them!  Most of Texas is Fields of cotton and cattle, but the cities are the complete opposite! They are Packed with People and Cars Rushing like a wolf pack to get to work. Texas is also famous for its brisket which is incredibly good. Traveling or moving to Austin, Texas is worth your time because of its awesome location, Unique weather, and enjoyable activities. That is why you should travel to Austin, Texas sometime.
Beautiful space & great people.
If you need help with any form of conference..both personal (family reunion, wedding, etc.) or business (huge conferences, business meeting, team building)

Visit Austin perfectly showcases the commitment, quality, and dependability our industry strives to maintain. It is an outright pleasure to be a small cog in the wheel that makes this city so welcoming and unforgettable.
Has the size and location you expect in a convention center.

name: You're My Butter Half Mural
address: 2000 E Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews:
While in Austin my husband and I visited all the murals we could in one day and this was, if not my very favorite, one of. 

It has a super convenient place you can put your phone to set a timer and take the picture and it has a little blurb on a podium that you can read about the mural. 

So cute! Made it into one of our Mixtiles covering our living room!
Recommend visiting while site seeing in Austin! It's an iconic Instagram worthy mural!
AMAZING pictures and even had a phone stand to take photos if you don’t have an extra person!! street parking available, as well as a few spaces in the United Way. when we went there was no line!
This mural Photographs beautifully. Great for taking selfies in front of!!

It's just somewhere to snap photos.
There's also a place that'll hold your phone so you can do selfies.

name: Live Love Paddle
address: 1610 E Riverside Dr, Austin, TX 78741, USA
reviews: Thoroughly enjoyed kayaking down the river with Austin city buildings in the background.  This was the first time ever on a kayak and it was exhilarating. The staff were very informative and helpful in mounting and dismounting the kayak. They also had tandems and paddle boards. Fun for all ages. They supply everything you need for a good time. And it was inexpensive.

10/10 would recommend! 
Everyone who works here is super friendly and made it feel like we were old friends getting together to go paddling! The 4th of July tour was spectacular, the sunset was perfect, and we had a beautiful panoramic view of downtown Austin.
You could hear the symphony playing from the water. And it was the perfect place to watch the fireworks! “⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️”

I cannot recommend this place enough. They couldnt have made the kayak-renting process any easier for us. Parking was a little tight in front of the store, but there was a free parking garage right across the street. There is a short walk down to the dock with the paddles. The staff was unbelievably personable and fun to talk to. I was very anxious about getting in and out of the kayak on the dock and the employees made me feel at ease. We kayaked under the bridge towards the city which was an incredible way to see Austin for the first time. The price was great too. We paid just under $40 for two kayaks, two drinks, and the tip for the employees.

Best place to view bats in Austin. Sunset paddle and tour. Everyone who looks down from the bridge sees mostly shadows. Look up and see the glory against the twilight sky. Support this ecological wonder of the world.
Loved this place staff is very friendly and very helpful. Great atmosphere enjoyed it every time my wife and I went. For sure worth the experience when visiting Austin on a sunny day

name: Emma Long Metropolitan Park
address: 1600 City Park Rd, Austin, TX 78730, USA
reviews: Love this location in the Austin area. It is very beautiful. Right next to the Colorado river where there are places to have a nice picnic or even places to camp during peak seasons. Very well kept and would definitely visit again for sure.

We were traveling from Maine to visit my family in Austin. We reserved a utility site on the river.
The site was spacious and the river pretty
The bench seat on our table was missing
The bathroom was dirty and the showers open with no privacy. I rigged up a shower curtain with a beach towel 
There is no place to wash dishes so you have to wash them at your site 
My complaint is about the lack of staff at this park
There were homeless people staying under a tarp on a picnics table and a huge party given by people who didn’t  tent a site, they drove into the park. There isn’t anyone at the entrance. They decided to set up next to our site. They played loud music and drank alcohol until nearly midnight. They came over to our site repeatedly,  we almost called the police but they left about 11:50 leaving 5 huge bags of garbage behind
I spoke to a man who worked at the park the following morning. He told me it happened all the time at this park. They obviously don’t care. We will never stay there again. It is not a safe place to camp with children and especially not in a tent
The bike trails are pristine.  Awesome scenery.  You can find some great views of the hills.
Showers weren't that great and the road to the entrance is very long took us a while to find the camp sites but it was fun and we had a great time
Park is awesome.  Huge area for picnics near the water, hiking, etc.  I typically go during the week so the crowds are kept to a minimum.

name: Republic Square
reviews: There are public restrooms, which is good id you need to go.  On the other hand, it also means that the dozens of homeless that live in the square can use them/hang out near them too.  They actually drove a local business (Round Rock Honey) out of the area with their violence and harassment.

This nice young lady had assisted me in finding the right bus stop. Sguck with all the way there at # 2 & 6 East Bound she was wearing an Ambassador type uniform and she was very polite and courteous.  This is a great, safe place to be. Thank you. And be sure to give that gal a round of applause!!! Thank you .🤗

There's a lot of people who aren't privileged in this area, but there are a lot of events here. Every Saturday there's a Farmer's market and that's why I go. They have artsy things. And it's a bus stop. So if you don't want to park or find parking, there's a way to avoid that. It's pretty dope.

If you're catching the bus, a taxi or just plain old CATCHING up, this is the centralized meeting location. Clean. Safe. Friendly. Clean public restrooms, security and shops, including a DOMINOES right across from the Park.
Did I mention that it has Clean Public Restrooms? ;)
Aesthetically and visually pleasing.Has places to charge you phone. Clean and available restrooms. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the day with your friends and family.

name: Gus Fruh
address: 2642 Barton Hills Dr, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: Gorgeous hike and creek entry point. There’s plenty of swimming spots deep and not deep on this trail. Keep in mind that the trail is partially blocked by trees. After the blockage, it gets really hairy. The trail is thin and climbing through lots of rocks and tree roots. It is not an easy walking hike for many! Bring hiking shoes. After a short 15 minute walk through the cliff side, we discovered beautiful views and place for us to hang out. Loved it!

Very nice place to hike and bike. I saw a lot of bikers there while I was there for a research project for a class called Planet Earth in my school, and I had a very enjoyable experience. I would definitely recommend visiting Gus Fruh if you need some fresh air or green for a refresher.

Have a nice day!
Truly incredible and beautiful in all parts. Take the trail that's waterside first.
Nice rock beach. Deep swimming hole. Rope swing 😎
Great when there is water. One easy windy trail for the kiddos. Water is clear and usually wading level.

name: Butler Metro Park
address: 1000 Barton Springs Rd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: Awesome park to picnic, motorized scooters to rent & ride there, let your dogs run & play, go check out the pond where I saw 2 fresh water otters ( no one go mess with them please) Honestly was shocked to see those 2 otters there since I have lived in Austin for 32 years and never seen this before. Awesome place to do some art work, yoga, meditate, just relax in the sun, or work-out but overall it is a cool park

Beautiful park, Austin residents should be thankful for having such an amazing park. The combination of nature and city is surreal. Clear water river, calm enough for many canoes and little boats. Right next to it, the amazing and modern Austin Skyline. This park helps you explore this amazing location.

Beautiful park along the water that is like heaven for dogs! So much room to run, things to sniff, and fun to be had. Also lots of pretty places to sit, picnic, read, and relax for humans. Great spot to be on a nice day or around sunset!

Incredible view of the Austin skyline. Having lived here for most of my life, it really is special to see how much Austin has changed and reminisce about the "good old days" and celebrate the good new days to come 👍

Very beautiful and super clean park. You will find people doing almost all sort of activities you can imagine doing outdoors. Running, dancing, cycling, playing sports, working out, dog-walking sightseeing, boating, picnicking..you name it. For every activity you will have plenty of space available there. The location of the park and the Austin downtown view from a different angle are bonuses.

name: Pease District Park
reviews: One of my favorite parks in Austin for volleyball and pickup sports. It also includes an off leash dog park and pristine (short) running trails. Limited parking sometimes.

A park offers bike trails, playground, picnic area and "fossil picking". Lots of people walk their dogs here. You can bike or walk along Shoal Creek to other greenbelt park, too. This is one of my kids' favorite parks in Austin.

Very clean, came here for Tai Chi event and ended up walking around the area for a couple miles.

There are a few homeless but they aren't causing trouble.

Bonus was seeing air plants on the trees growing in their natural habitat as well as cute lizards scurrying.

This was a very fun place to explore. There’s a lot of random cool foresty areas that we went into and also in these pictures, some rivery areas. I’m not sure what else to call them but I enjoyed going here a lot and especially with friends. Beautiful scenery, clean park, not a lot of people, and its fun. There’s also usually a lot of space to roam around so its a great park to go to in Austin. If you need some of the s e c r e t spots this is one to show up to. Not that secret but perfect for all your Austin friend shenanigans.
A good park to stroll around. I really enjoy that they didn't do the typical Austin updates, but left it familiar.

name: Uchi
address: 801 S Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: This place is tip top. Each dish is carefully planned with many elements and the complexity in each flavor combo is simply epic. I never feel inspired to leave reviews and here I am so I can find it again. Come here and be delighted. This is top notch, be ready to spend a grip of money. I’m currently sitting here waiting for the bill telling myself It was without a doubt worth it.
I went in February when they had their Valentine’s Menu and it was delicious!! We had a great waiter, the drinks were fantastic and so was every dish! I highly recommend.

The food was absolutely phenomenal. There are plenty of reviews discussing how lovely the meal is. What really put this experience over the top for us was the customer service. The hostess and our server Melissa were both incredible, charismatic, attentive and had the intuition to really make sure our meal was perfect. Definitely recommend the omakase route- the people here will absolutely take care of you.

I have to say I was impressed.  Not just your average eat rolls sushi type of person but the I've traveled to Japan to eat at Michelin level sushi spots.

The rice is spot on, they had an array of both traditional and unique fish to try and a changing menu.

Was able to get sit at the bar as a solo diner so no wait and the service was impeccable.

Simply amazing and perfect in every way. We had a large-ish group of 7 and enjoyed a relaxed dinner on a saturday night when the restaurant was busy. The service was impeccable and we felt we were treated like we were the only table in the place. The staff were incredibly generous and personable. The food was nothing short of extraordinary. This restaurant was highly recommended to us from friends. We love sushi and this a James Beard Award winner. We were told they do not take reservations so get there when they open or be prepared to wait. Good information and spot on. We arrived at 4:30 with hopes of being seated a 5:00. Perfect.

name: Odd Duck
address: 1201 S Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: I've been sitting here trying to decide whether the cocktails or the food were the highlight of the evening, and that pretty much sums the place up. Excellent food, and equally excellent(and unique) cocktails. Rotating menu with farm to table options - every item on their menu shows where it was sourced. Fast and friendly service with complimentary valet. Cannot go wrong with this place. I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Took me way to long to finally get here and very pleased.  Great atmosphere, service, and fairly priced.  Enjoyed all 6 items ordered, but 2 (recommendations from our server) really stood out as special.  10/10 will be going back to try the rest of the menu and seasonally as the menu changes.

Works for us. Have not had enough. Probably won’t in the foreseeable future. 5 star concept, service, food prep, product, delivery, and ambiance – food, drink, atmosphere – all works. And, they held back some of my favorite barrel aged drink for us – who knew they actually read the reviews ?! Tried them every which way on all accounts, and mediocrity, much less failure, are not in the vocabulary. Get your smile eraser appointment in advance. It will take a while to restore any semblance of an expressionless face, Austin traffic notwithstanding. Bring your pocketbook, but be prepared to lose your mind and give a flying flip what the damage is. Not my first time, and can vouch for the result – introduced probably double digit folks to this tortuously resplendent exercise in gustatory delight, and never found a naysayer. Flip me over, I’m almost done! I’m out. I’m happy. Good night. (smiling, disturbingly, possibly, to some, all the rest of the evening)

Gave it 4 stars for the atmosphere and for trying, and while its a nice rustic place with great cocktails,  I expected more from the food. Heard some mush of the place, but food is luck of genuine flair of flavors. Not much of creativity either but just a mix of what seems to sounds good on the paper but the result is poor and the ingredients do not bland well with each other.

No fries, no parking at lunch, and no way you won't love Odd Duck. It's a seasonal menu restaurant covering all your taste preferences. The fish tacos and wagyu burger are the most popular and it's easy to see why when you taste them. You almost can't find a better flavor balance in Austin. Wash it down with a cocktail that has been aged for a month like the Martinez. Be sure to come during off hours if arriving without reservations because it does fill and parking is limited.

name: Franklin Barbecue
reviews:
The best BBQ I have ever had, and I worked in a BBQ restaurant for years. The rub was so flavorful, the meat was so tender and juicy. The sides of beans and potato salad were delicious. Price wise, it is completely fair! Good BBQ costs money, and this place does not disappoint.
I eaten here 4 times and I tried everything and it's all 100% top notch BBQ on a level you have to try for yourself

Had the Brisket, Ribs, Sausage, Turkey, and sides. Brisket and turkey were my favorite. Both were very juicy, had great flavor, and brisket fell apart. Ribs were very good as well. Sausage could use a little help. Potato Salad had a strong mustard flavor which is different from what I'm used to but still enjoyed it. Make sure you eat it as soon as you can while warm.

As a Texan with a ton of choices, I can honestly say that the guys in my family cook better BBQ. The texture of the meat was fine, but all of it was way over-salted. Over-salted to the point that I stopped wanting to eat it. The sausage was just OK. Best thing if I had to choose was the pork ribs, but I wouldn't recommend this over every other BBQ joint in Texas. Long ago, Sam's in east Austin would've knocked this place out of the water. For the wait, the time and the price, unless you want to say you've eaten Franklin's, head elsewhere.

Best brisket I've ever had!  Juicy with just the right amount of spice!  Get there VERY EARLY.  It's worth the wait in line.  Plus they have extra chairs to sit outside in the early morning hours (hint 530am good time to get there).  Pack a cooler or grab some Java. Do NOT miss out.

We debated whether a 2 hour wait for "the
best brisket in Austin" was worth it, and decided that tasting it was the best way to find out. We were not disappointed! 

On top of the excellent food, the staff was incredibly friendly. They accurately estimated our wait time, took orders in line, and gave everyone reasonable expectations of whether there would be enough brisket, ribs etc. 

We showed up at 10:45am on a rainy Wednesday and were among the last to get brisket and ribs. They were sold out of everything by 1pm.

name: Uchiko
address: 4200 N Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78756, USA
reviews: Still one of Austin's best restaurants. Expertly designed and prepared, the food here is sublime. It's way more than a sushi restaurant with plenty of cooked items and interesting twists on traditional Japanese cuisine. Everything I've had here over the years has been delicious. I highly recommend you ask your server on the best order to receive and eat your dishes since the more subtle and delicate dishes can be over powered by the holder ones. And definitely try the Breakfast Cereal dessert! Happy hour is a bargain here for the quality of food you receive. Make reservations if you can, it's always crowded.

Probably one of the best dining experiences in Austin. Every dish is prepared very intentionally and artfully. Service is excellent and the drinks are fantastic! 
I actually came back two nights in a row!

Incredible design and ambience for a date night or a group for social occasions. They also have a great happy hour if you want to check out their offerings before committing to a big night there. I will say it's definitely a fusion Japanese place. Not so much traditional. This is a place to explore, not necessarily get a traditional roll you would normally get. They're cocktails are beyond what you would normally expect at an upscale place because they try different things. They also have an extensive sake collection.

In my opinions I would avoid comparing the so call authentic Japanese foods which I have opportunities to enjoy in Japan with same type of Japanese foods I have had in U.S.A. The availability of original ingredients and the different ethnic taste palates would require making some modifications in ethnic foods we sample here. Nonetheless, I was very pleased with the selections picked from Uchiko’s menu.

I enjoyed the romantic ambience of the restaurant. I tried the crab roll, tuna roll, prime rib, and Jasmine cream. The food was very flavorful and delicious. I love the the creativity in regards to the flavor combinations. However portion sizes are very small. Overall I had a great experience. I will be back.

name: Jeffrey's
address: 1204 W Lynn St, Austin, TX 78703, USA
reviews:
Great date or anniversary atmosphere. The servers know it's a special occasion, and treat you very well. It seems more "old Austin" and traditional.

Food is good - they are not doing anything particularly unique, but doing what they do well. 

The martini cart is a bit gimmicky or fun, depending on your mood. 

Would recommend

One of the best restaurants I've ever been to, I've had nearly every steak house worth mentioning in Houston and this place is right there or better than the best. I was not left disappointed in any way. Great food, service and atmosphere. I will definitely be back when I'm in the Austin area.

This place is set in a super cool quaint area, near downtown Austin but nestled in a neighborhood.  This place is all about service and ambiance with a touch of excellent food on the side!  They are most none for their steaks according to our server but she stated everything on our menu can compete for the best, so we tested other dishes.  I had the seafood risotto and my wife had the dover sole.  Our word...magically delicious!  If you like chic, cool, hip but not over the top places try this spot.

10* if I could give it: this restaurant is a well oiled machine! Definitely on top of all the fine dining restaurants I’ve experienced so far all around the world. I mean the service was impressive: a bunch of different waiters gravitated so discreetly around our table the entire evening, reading our minds and taking care of each detail. Couldn’t pick a better place to celebrate my husband’s birthday: intimate, relaxing, romantic! No need to say the food was memorable also! We will be back!

Probably one the best dining experience that you can find in Austin. Food is amazing and services are impeccable from checking in to last step out of the restaurant. There's no better way to take your special someone for a memorable dining experience. They filled up quick so reservation is the key.  The only item that I was skeptical was the baked alaska. The whiskey is a bit strong and they use a carrot cake base, which I am not a huge fan.  Nevertheless, it was pretty majestic seeing a flambéed dish coming your way. We will come back for sure!!

name: Moonshine Grill
address: 303 Red River St, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews:
Such a wonderful place to dine in with the family. They have a very excellent place, great outdoor and indoor seating with a good patio. They have a good interior setting, cozy inside and minimalist decor. Seating was quite good with its great chairs and tables. We had our seat right away as we dine in for brunch.

When it comes to food I was very overwhelmed and also my wife to the food we had. Their menu was extensive and plenty of options but our entree were Hanger steak with Mac n Cheese and breaded chicken breast and artichoke to my wife. The food was well-cooked and has a decent taste. It was delicious and the ingredients were on-point. Well-prepared and portions were average. They have a great selection of drinks as well. We had their Lemonade cocktail and it tastes so delicious and refreshing.
Fantastic service, the staff was very attentive and welcoming as well.

Location was close to our conference at The Fairmont and I'm so glad we stopped here for lunch. We had fried green tomatoes for an appetizer and the Hanger Steak special. Both were amazing. We hanger steak was nice and tender. Also had the Hard Lemonade which was good. Our server was Glenn and he was so spot on and efficient. He's a highlight for sure!

Cool vibe, terrible parking situation. Closed road takes you to a parking lot that costs $20. Valet is only $9 though but waiting around for your car can be tough. 

Vibe is you basic trendy, dark space, small bar but cool employees. They are friendly and attentive and seem to handle the chaos well. Wait times are a bit too long for my liking. 

Food was pretty good. Grits were thicker than I expected but were well seasoned and soaked up sauce well. Shrimp had a nice flavor and were cooked very well. Beyond burger was forgettable, fries were fine, tots were better. Steak was delicious and fried green tomatoes were a hit. Worth the visit but arrive before 5:15.

The manager came out and showed me all the gluten free options on the buffet.   That was so nice.  The patio was beautiful.  We were there right before Christmas so they had a beautiful real Christmas tree on the patio that smelled wonderful.  The drinks are amazing too. We will come back.

Location was close to our conference at The Fairmont and I'm so glad we stopped here for lunch. We had fried green tomatoes for an appetizer and the Hanger Steak special. Both were amazing. We hanger steak was nice and tender. Also had the Hard Lemonade which was good. Our server was Glenn and he was so spot on and efficient. He's a highlight for sure!

name: Launderette
reviews: Great food and atmosphere. Came here for lunch and the food was perfect. Nice mix of menu items. Cute inside and although the patio was closed for some maintenance, it looked really cozy too. Highly recommend. And not to be taken for granted, the service was excellent!

We've bee meaning to go here for 2 years and finally made it last night. It was all we could hope for and more. We didn't have reservations so we sat at the bar. Food was fantastic and service from Jeff working the bar was some of the best we've ever experienced anyway. He was extremely busy but very attentive ensuring that our time at Launderette was one that we would not forget.  Kudos to Jeff. We will definitely be back soon.

We are very excited to live so close to this Austin gem. We just moved in down the street and tonight was our first night dining here. We got the brussel sprouts and cauliflower as our choice for small bits. Both were incredible! My Old Fashion was perfection and the bartender, Jeff, whipped up an incredible Penicillin for my boyfriend. This is absolutely our new hangout spot. We can't wait to go back.

I loved the atmosphere at Launderette! It is absolutely adorable. And the food was great! I had bacon and eggs (I think it's called the American?) and the pricing and portions were just right. Get the zucchini bread... Amazing!

Excellent atmosphere. Great menu. Horribly pretentious, especially for a neighborhood restaurant - they carefully prioritize their clientele, like a valet prioritizes the cars parked next to the valet booth. Including, one time, insisting that we had to sit outside in 38-40F temperatures, with our newborn, despite there being open tables inside. One of the best burgers in Austin, though it and some other plates are a bit overpriced for their quality. Note to people with special diets or food allergies: Launderette consistently provides no sympathy/alternatives.

name: Barley Swine
reviews: Definitely the best meal I had while in Austin during a weeklong business trip there. Had a reservation, but opted for the bar since I was by myself. Glad I did as I was able to watch the chef and his team prepare a number of different dishes. There must have been 12 people in that kitchen working in unison, each doing his or her part to make every dish special. I was drawn to Barley Swine because it promised farm fresh, seasonal produce, and a creative culinary team. As I was seated, the bartender gave me a menu and said quick, pick something, happy hour is almost over. It was 6:30pm. A $7 tequila cocktail was a perfect way to start along with some shrimp and grits for about half off.

Wow! Everything we ordered at this restaurant was delicious. Great selection of small plates, you have to pick about 2 per person. We split the Pork Shoulder as our 'main course'. Totally tasty. They also have a $95 chef tasting menu if you would rather them make the choices for you! The cocktail menu is just as varied. I got the Stone Road whiskey drink, and my dad got the Fried Chicken Infused tequila drink. It even came with a tiny chicken wing on the side! Perfect restaurant for a celebration or a small night out. Nice southern atmosphere. Oh, and Parking is Valet.

This place should be named as one of the Michelin stared restaurant! Barley Swine never fails to interesting me with their renovations of the tasting menu! They always make sure that’s they deliver the best food quality from the freshness to the taste of their food to their customers! They have very good drink selections  from wine to cocktails! Also great atmosphere for couple, as well as big group party!

Superb dining experience and service! Pig Face Rolls and  smoked goat dish were definite highlights. Great cocktail and beer/wine selections too. We live very close to Burnet Road location. Can't believe we took so long to stop in. We had regular menu tonight but will be back for tasting menu ASAP.  Wow!

Highly recommend the tasting menu on Sundays when its discounted. Went with a group of 6 and the food was phenomenal. Plus they were really great about catering to my dietary restriction, so would highly recommend!

name: Suerte
reviews: Excellent variety of delicious small plates, and main entrees.  Great ambience.  The Don Dario margarita was really unique and tasted great.  Will definitely be going back again!

The food was good and fairly unique compared to most traditional restaurant. Staff was friendly and efficient. The plates were a little small and our group felt they fell short on quantity for each plate they brought out for our group. So in other words, for each plate or dish they brought out for our group of diners, they brought at least one portion short and we felt this could have easily been fixed.

Basically - unimpressive. Not a great value.

It's a beautiful space - very sleek and dimly light and nicely painted. All the trappings are spot on... given our tech-city vibe. 

However, the food was bland. We went out with a friend, ordered two drinks and a smattering of dishes. The bill was over $100 and we were generally unsatisfied. I can't really remember any of the dishes, which is an indicator of its worth. I do recall a tiny, expensive tamale. 

The waiter was rude and dismissive. I understand that we all get weeded on occasion, but the behavior kinda added to a generally un-great experience. 

Not worth the effort.

Excellent food. Sharing each plate family style was a wonderful sample of the menu. Eric helped with the arrangement of the food delivery. I would recommend this for any group who wants good food and fun while eating it.

Excellent, fresh food that tastes like it's been made with a lot of thought & care. Amazing service; everyone was very attentive & kind. Creative, peaceful ambiance. 
The only thing that was a little disappointing was that the portions were really small.

name: Fonda San Miguel
address: 2330 W N Loop Blvd, Austin, TX 78756, USA
reviews: Great restaurant for any night of the week but Saturday nights always a great night out. This place gets packed, the bar area is free seating, you’d need a reservation for larger parties for sure but also just to secure your table here. It’s a very popular restaurant. They have valet parking, and a car park. The staff are very attentive, they don’t bother you but make sure you’re good on drinks and food. We had lots of appetizers and beers and margaritas. I have a hangover this morning but it was so worth it! Life’s short play loud we had such a fun time here catching up with friends and storytelling. As the night went on the stories got funnier. Oh and we had ice cream with some choc sauce over it yummy. If you live in Austin drop by some time. If you’re visiting Austin the food and atmosphere is authentic.

So grateful that our favorite Austin restaurant for 45 years is doing curbside pick-up.  Saturday my wife and I decided to have a "date" -- set the table at home, even dressed up a little.  Ordered (and paid -- one less "touch") online, established a pick-up time, stayed in the car as our well-packaged food was graciously placed in the back seat, went home and had a magnificent meal.  Multiple meals, actually -- such generous portions.  And the usual excellent food.  Big thanks to Donnie and the team for a little bit of Austin normalcy in these times.  We love you guys.

This is a very happening spot, awesome atmosphere and we were surprised to be seated so fast on a Friday night. We tried tacos and shrimp and old fashions. It all came out correct and quickly. I will recommend this spot and maybe try their brunch this year. To get 5 stars they need more restroom stalls (there was a wait) and our server really didn't chat us up, (most likely he was just super busy).

This is a beautiful restaurant, you have to see the gardens. It’s a great place to celebrate something special with a big group, they serve crowds seamlessly and there’s plenty of space. The food is very authentic, any of there enchiladas are on point. There is plenty of good Mexican food in Austin, but this place takes the cake on atmosphere. They have great margaritas too, I’ve heard the brunch is amazing!

This place is way overrated. 
If you value your money... it is quite expensive.
If you expect a well-served dish for the amount you're paying... go somewhere else.
If you know about Mexican food... you'll be disappointed. 

I enjoy paying good money for good food but I don't understand all the good reviews this place has when you'll find better food at a food truck.

name: Salty Sow
reviews:
A group of us decided to try this place the day before Valentine's Day to beat the rush. 

All I can say is WOW! We had a bunch of different things and we all shared. There wasn't one thing that didn't taste spectacular. 

We shared the Warm Olives and Triple Fried Duck Fat Fries. Both were exceptional, especially the hot, crispy and perfect tasting fries with egg and Bearnaise sauce. 

For dinner I had the Milk-Braised Pork Butt with White Beans. It was marvelous. The meat was fork tender and really tasty, the beans perfect. 

Tastes of the other dinners, another pork dish and Swordfish, all were really good. We shared a Banana dessert that was great also. The service was as good as service can be. This is obviously a great restaurant and we will be back for sure.

We stopped in for a light dinner and ended up enjoying a few tasty draft craft beers with equally tasty appetizers off the Happy Hour menu. The truffled deviled eggs were large and delicious, and the biscuits and Rosemary honey fried chicken thighs......WOW, they were great! Actually they were incredibly great! Highly recommend a stop here. The atmosphere is very chill and you will be happy you dropped in! Our server Chris was also super friendly and efficient!

Wow... and I do mean wow. The food at this place is incredible. They brought me a pot roast that literally came in the pot. The bananas foster beignets (you read that correctly) is in my top 3 desserts. The only reason it gets 4 stars and not 5 is because the drinks leave a little something to be desired. I feel like they could improve the ingredients, the recipes, or both... and produce a better margarita. Other than that though the food is quite perfect!

Great food and awesome atmosphere, with a super friendly staff. Prices are very reasonable considering the quality, and compared to most “new American” style restaurants. The Happy Hour is something you should take serious advantage of too.

Great experience. The servers were friendly and helped us squeeze in on a packed evening when we should have made reservations. The staff was all very caring and attentive. 

The food was amazing. Pork belly was perfectly done, delightfully seasoned, and served over collard greens. The duck fat fries were pretty amazing also.

name: Olamaie
address: 1610 San Antonio St, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: The service is great. They're always there when you need them but never intrusive. The food was wonderful. Get the lemon bar for dessert, it is the best I have had outside of Paris.
The food is amazing, every dish we took. The portions are not tiny as you would expect in such upscale place. The service is great.
Friendly service. A relaxed atmosphere with a very homey feel. Thoughtful cocktails and fantastic food. We will definitely come back.

Great restaurant in a cool old house with a few amazing dishes. They'll tell you about it but make sure to order a bunch of the off menu biscuits with honey butter. Easily the best thing that we ate. The hoppin john was also fantastic and the crisped rice was a nice touch. Service was uncomfortably good! :)

We got a last minute reservation in the patio on a chilly night. But with the heating lamps on, it was really pleasant sitting outside. The snapper was excellent and you can't go wrong with eating too many of their biscuits.

name: Bouldin Creek Cafe
reviews: I am honestly a picky eater, and trying to be vegetarian sometimes complicates that, but this was some of the best vegetarian food I've had in a while. It was seasoned well and cooked to excellence. I tried some of my friends' dishes and I didn't find one thing I did not like. My only suggestion is to plan ahead for parking because their lot seems to get full and tight very quickly.

Bouldin Creek made my “meat ever meal” to “it’s okay not having meat for ever meal” transition sooooo easy. Their Ruben is better than a classic Ruben. Whenever I go here, I try something new and am always pleased. Never have I ever left unsatisfied. Not to mention a true gem of a interior design with a sweet little coffee shop and bar.

Fan!  Big fan!  Love this place!  

Fresh creative menu. Healthy options with lots of choices for those days when you want something a little more decadent.  Great brunch. Yummy salads. Variety of cuisines. So much wrapped up in this amazing place. Expect a wait but you can get on the waitlist before you arrive by going to Yelp.

Good vibes at this super hip eatery.  Laid back atmosphere with a great pooch friendly patio.  Lots of great plant based food choices that will satisfy the pickiest of eaters.  The cornbread is a must try!  We will be back!

We were driving from Midland, TX after a cancelled comic convention. We were STARVING, so we decided to eat lunch with my sister and she chose this place. It was. SO. GOOD. Even my carnivore friend enjoyed his penne pasta dish he got! Also, the lavender lemonade was exactly what we needed to get refreshed to make the final several hours of our road trip back to Houston perfect. Thank you Bouldin Creek Cafe. We loved everything we ordered! Oh, order the stir fry. ❤❤❤❤

name: LENOIR
reviews: Incredible food and warm, thoughtful staff! The carrots are absolute bliss. Be sure to pick up a loaf of their bread when you go! It's always a huge hit with our friends and family. We just love it here!!

The atmosphere of this place is insanely cute! If you're looking for a memorable date night, this is definitely the place. All the dishes we had were great, but the desserts are what shined the brightest to me!

Such a lovely experience. I’m a big sf foodie in town for the weekend and was so impressed with everything about this place. Quaint small atmosphere that feels very homey. Kind attentive service. And incredible food. Especially the whole roasted fish, perfect. Highly recommend.

Most enjoyable meal by far. Had an awesome time with my friend's. The host Bryan was very friendly and knowledgeable in addition to our waiter. Was throughly impressed with the baked items that accompanied our meal (not pictured) by Max Sage who was also recently on chopped. I definitely recommend taking a chance and delving into this fresh take on Indian/Mediterranean cuisine.

A French Country dining experience to enjoy!  We didn't know much before going in but it seems like they have some sort of modern french cuisine thing happening. It was also farm-to-table so it seems like their menu rotates often.  Either way, it was delicious!

We shared a variety of snacks and small plates, which was enough to fill us up (we were 3 women, just as a reference). We had the hush pups, smoked fish, the bao, stuffed quail, and other stuff I'm forgetting. They even elevated a bean salad! I mean ... seriously!  We certainly left room for dessert and their wine selection was superb.

It's a cute little restaurant off of 1st St. They have a couple of parking spots right next to the street, and slightly more spots in the back. But they're not prolific by any stretch.  No valet that I could see but you might want to call and check.

It seems like they have a lovely outdoor wine garden.  We're definitely planning on coming back when it gets a bit cooler so it's comfortable sitting outside 😎🍷

name: Foreign & Domestic
reviews: My friend and I were really excited about this place and, after going there for dinner, all we could say was "wow". Great service and great food, amazing wine menu. Small and unique and not too pricey, as someone else stated, and the small part means it can be noisy too (people, right?). I went for the tasting menu, and even though they did not have a vegetarian one for my partner, they were able to adapt and have dishes coming at the same time. I would only suggest a wine-pairing option for the tasting menu. Definitely the best we went to in Austin.

Gnocchi and pasta made in-house. Chefs Sarah and Nathan are a great team that produce innovative, fresh, and balanced dishes. While known for their "whole animal" approach which can be eye opening for some, they also have a rich and varied vegetarian selection of dishes.

Absolutely wonderful, top to bottom, this restaurant was a delight. The service, the food, the atmosphere, it was a perfect evening. I'm a picky eater AND a vegetarian, so I was apprehensive, but I had a variety of options and they were all good!! My husband, a serious omnivore, agrees. Honestly, I've never been blown away by a salad! I wish I could have it every day! My only regret is that the first courses were so good I didn't have more room by the time the entrees came. The service too was incredible! Special kudos to our server, Max, who went above and beyond. I loved the lemon curd dressing so much he asked the chef and added a little cup of it in our to go bag ❤️ All the servers and the host did an awesome job. If we lived in Austin this would be our go to for a special evening. Thank you, F&D!!

Excuse my french but DAMN this place was good.  We were lucky to get right in for Sunday brunch.  It was SO good. The flavors were delicious. My taste buds were WHOA! Its a must. Small place so make a reso.

Came here for brunch (definitely need a reservation).  I have the steak and eggs which might be my favorite steak and eggs ever.  Friends had the burger (good) and the blueberry crepe? (AMAZING)  my ONLY wish and reason for one star deduction is that I wish they had an espresso machine.

name: Truluck's
reviews: Delicious food and great service. The steak was phenomenal and the scenery is one of a kind. Price was a little over the top but if you have the money it is worth every penny.

The food was phenomenal. We got stone crab claws, tuna tartare, meatballs, and oysters. Down a star because the last thing we ordered was oysters.. from the time we ordered them to the time we got them it was around 30 minutes of wait time and our server completely ignored us. My boyfriend even ended up pouring me the rest of the wine himself because we weren’t even checked in on in that time. Oysters were also small for the price. Everything was great up until the end, sadly.

Great restaurant in the heart of downtown.  Good for large groups, small parties and intimate dining.  Live music and very good drink and food happy hour specials.  Management and staff are extremely attentive. Extensive wine list and good cocktails.  While a generally a seafood.restaurant (and the seafood is so good) there are also steaks that as a good as any steakhouse in the area.  Worth the visit!

Absolutely delicious food! I've never had escargot before and it was amazing. The soft that it came in was so good and had a very lemon creamy taste. We also got the oysters, the brine was salty and so good. It came with a bunch of sauces that you can put over it! The drinks were very good as well. I highly recommend their wine, very good wine choices. Definitely coming back!

This is an excellent bar. The bartenders are usually top notch. However, if you can get one of the male bartenders they usually are better at customer service. I say this because every once in awhile when I visit downtown I like to have a cocktail or a glass of wine here and every time I have had a male bartender, they are usually kinder, attentive, and will talk to you. The females however are a whole different story. Unless you look like a Chad model, they will barely talk to you other than saying "open or closed tab?" without a hint of a smile. I have not eaten here yet and hopefully when I have a date one day I will try out their food.

name: Kemuri Tatsu-Ya
reviews: I've always liked this place, to say the least, but during quarantine I LOVE it! Their brisket bowl is out of this world. I crave it at least 3 times a week and have been talking about it over FaceTime non stop to anyone who will listen. Please keep it on the menu! The service is out of this world. Thanks for always being so cool.

Oh man, I can't say enough great things! To start, I will say that it's a bit pricey, and the portions are on the small side. However, between the ambiance, the service, the fantastically original takes on Asian/Texas Smokehouse cuisine, you absolutely get what you pay for. Such unique menu selections. We tried a LOT of options and loved, literally, everything. They give you instructions with each dish, and trust me. Every step elevates each experience. Hats off to the chefs. Cheers!

Innovative, small plates Japanese in a funky neighbor setting outside downtown. Clearly, a hipster spot. A very younger crowd, my daughter pointed out I was the oldest person in the restaurant at 8:30pm.. great cocktails, the smoked mackerel was perfection, flavor and texture. I wish someone would reinvent those fried tako balls... these were no better than others. My only disappointment.. well worth the drive, reservations recommended.
My wife and I ordered take-out last night and both beef and chicken bento bowls were amazing! A coordinated explosion of southern, smokey flavor with Asian spices. 🤤

Recommend trying several things from the “weird menu” (you nasty!) as well as ordering the pickled cucumber salad to go along with all of your dishes. Most of the plates have a heavy or smoky flavor and the cucumber is light and refreshing, serves as an intermezzo course. The marinated jellyfish has a texture like none other! Will return for the BBQ ramen!

name: Lonesome Dove Austin
reviews:
They have perfected takeout! Great packaging. Terrific presentation in a to go container (seriously, how does one do that?).
The best meal I've had since this all started.

Go get a great meal, you will be so happy!
Foods are strange and interesting! Meat quality is great, my I hope there is more sauce for steaks. Overall satisfied. Recommend ones who like to explore and experience.
This place is great! Staff very friendly! Very eloquent. Burger and prime rib were delicious. It was out so quickly also. The decorations were amazing and the seating was very comfortable 👌

My girl and I don't high paying jobs so it was really nice that we could go somewhere for lunch that was super good and didn't break the bank. Best burger I've had in a very long time. We'll definitely go back soon

If you read my bio, you'll see I am finally realizing my dream of being a "food critic" in Austin, Texas. I will be posting my honest and uninfluenced opinions on everything from the front door to paying the check (no handheld credit card machines, please). For my first batch of reviews I am seeking out the true Austin staple: meat. What better place to start than rustic Lonesome Dove?

name: True Food Kitchen
address: 222 West Ave Ste HR100, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: True Food Kitchen was just a delight to visit. We were looking for some creative food with good quality and they delivered. The service was great from the first minute until we left. Out food arrived quickly, we were very happy with the amount of food and the options in the menu. The restaurant itself is also very nice. We preferred to sit in the patio, with the heaters, it was perfect. Inside it was a little too noisy than I prefer. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're trying to eat healthy as well. They have several choices in the menu for every taste and diet.

Fantastic food: creative recipes with fresh, savory ingredients; a large vegetarian selection. A good-size wine list and a selection of locally brewed beers, though not on tap. Excellent service: professional and thoughtful, with your glasses topped off and dishes cleared away in a timely, unobtrusive manner. Highly recommend the roasted cauliflower appetizer.

Delicious food and wonderful service. Went here for the first time the other night and had a great time. 

I had the Korean Noodle bowl with salmon and it was very tasty and filling. The salmon was perfectly cooked and juicy. Wish I had a photo, but ate too quickly! There was a tiny issue with my order and it was rectified immediately and they went above and beyond to fix it. Was not expecting that level of customer service!

We also ordered the roasted Brussels sprout and the fig & Gorgonzola flatbread - also delicious! Everyone enjoyed their meal.

Service was spot on as well and everyone we met was very friendly. The restaurant itself is also in a super cute area that you can explore before or after your meal.

Excellent heathy food choices and so full of flavor! Great service too! I love a casual meal here or meeting friends for a big celebration dinner. 
Special food needs, no problem. 
Even the drink and desert menus are wonderful!

Incredibly underwhelmed. My family and I were so excited to come try out this location as we had heard a lot of good things. There were 4 of us and we made reservations so we were seated quickly, but that was the peak of our service. 

Our orders were taken and our waiter forgot to bring 2/3 of our drinks, both forgotten drinks were just plain coffees (we had to remind him later and he made no comment about why the never arrived). 

We placed our orders, including an appetizer for the table and a bowl of soup as my entree. I also asked for bread to eat with my soup. The soup came before even our appetizer, so I had to eat before anyone else so it wouldn’t get cold, and they had forgotten my bread. 

I wouldn’t have even minded as much if the soup was worthwhile. The bowl was only half filled with lukewarm subpar tomato soup. 

Finally the appetizer arrived (fig and Gorgonzola flat bread) which was admittedly very good, shortly followed by the rest of the order. All of us were in agreement that it was decent, but not memorable or worth the price tag. 

The atmosphere is very fun and trendy which I can see as a huge attraction, but our service and food was incredibly disappointing. 

And as I am writing this, we are still waiting for our waiter to come around and hand us the check. I have lost track of time, I’m starting to get hungry again, send help.

name: Perry's Steakhouse & Grille
reviews: We are always doing what we haven’t done yet. The martinis are wonderful to start. Blueberry, Cucumber YUM After being seated in a booth because there were 5 of us we chose our appetizers. A booth is very hard to engage in conversation, corner to corner and I would insist on a table if ever doing this again. The appetizers were great. We had Shrimp, steak tartare and crab cakes. Delicious. Wine next. At this point I started to feel rushed. The atmosphere and food were very up class but I was disappointed with our server. 0 personality. The only way to show this is in the gratuity. 75.00 instead of 100.00$

Celebrated our anniversary here last night.  The ambience was very romantic, they spread rose petals on the table, it was a nice touch.  The food and service was outstanding.  It is expensive but the food was well worth it.  I loved every bite, it was a very special evening.

I absolutely love this place we were seated quickly. Nicholas our server was amazing he provided top notch service. I requested a nice romantic table for our anniversary and they went above and beyond. Our table was decorated with rose petals for the occasion. My expectations were exceeded. We will be returning!
We really enjoyed this place and sat outside which was very nice. Friendly server staff. Great food and we went there during the sunset.  We tried a couple of their drinks which were good.

Our favorite restaurant! We've been going to Perry's for years. They ALWAYS have great customer service, a romantic ambiance, and good food. We love their Famous Pork Chop, Mac n cheese, with their Fields Green Candied Pecan salad.

name: Veracruz All Natural Food Truck
reviews: I ate some VERY good food here. Particularly the guacamole was just perfect. It was all cheap as well! I’m taking off one star because there is not nearly enough covered areas to eat or wait in line. We waited in line with no shade for almost an hour. It was miserable. Despite the food being so good, I’m not sure it was worth it. They do have cheap water bottles, but it would be a lot better if they had water stations nearby. You still have to wait an hour to get your water after all! If I could go back and do things over, I’d stop by the brick and mortar version, not the truck.
I finally understand why everyone in Austin is crazy for Migas. Delicious. And juice was great.
Best Fish taco I ever had. Chips and guacamole were very fresh and chips were clearly home made. Might be the best food truck in Austin. Not the best area but worth the risk.
Great tacos! Had some breakfast tacos and some regular ones. Both were great. The area was great and we were able to meet up with a friend who had a dog.
Poss Best tacos in Austin, don't let the old prison bus look scare you. Friendly service with patience and good advice on menu. Decent prices and broad menu of tacos and drinks to choose from.

name: Justine's
reviews: I really like Justine’s. My husband and I love to go there for a nice dinner on special occasions. The reason for four stars is that our last dinner at Justine’s was a little lacking and the price per plate is pretty high. But all in all it’s a nice experience.

Justine's offers one of the best unique dining experiences in Austin. Year-round outdoor seating, daily menus paired with their stock menu, and a great cocktail + wine list. The staff reflect "Keep Austin weird". 

Highly recommend their seafood when it's available. I've enjoyed oysters and scallops. They also have a good french 75, leaning into the citrus component.

Very elegant and classy..The menu was well put to gather. My meal was excellent, very juicy, just simply the best. I love the music that was being played, it really set the mood..I will most definitely come back to this restaurant..

Fantastic restaurant. Great atmosphere and service. Daniel served me and my fiance and we both loved him and his seriously amazing customer service. The amazing employees there only add to the delicious food. All local and so delicious with a twist. Will be back tons!
My favorite French restaurant in Austin. Ambiance is beautiful and they have a great outdoor patio. Character and flavor is something they do not fall short on, their cocktails are superb as well.

name: Red Ash
address: Colorado Tower, 303 Colorado St #200, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: Amazing rustic Italian with a great atmosphere.   If you're looking for a great dry aged piece of meat this is your place.  Dont be fooled by the name they have amazing steak.

In town for the weekend. Wanted to have a nice dinner every night. The first night I went to a highly rated restaurant, but it wasn’t near as good as the Red Ash. I wanted to try the happy hour which starts at 4:30, I got there at 6pm. Everyone did their best to get me a seat. I was fortunate and got to sit at the chefs bar in front of the kitchen.
I ordered clams, in-house pasta, and the Caesar salad. Several of the professional waitstaff stopped and made sure that I had everything I needed. Everything that I had was excellent, I can’t wait to get back!
I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Happy hour or not this is by far one of the best restaurants that I’ve visited while in Austin.

Great date night spot downtown. Make a reservation or grab a seat at the bar (first come). The sides and starters are the best part of the menu, carrots and beans were delicious! Small portions of entrees are plenty and recommend sharing everything. Chianti Classico (2015) goes well with everything. Could be an occasion place or every night. Oh and sit downstairs for a better atmosphere. We sat at the kitchen table and enjoyed watching the show that is the staff!
They have the best pasta in this city. I would know I've tried every Italian restaurant in a 100mi radius! Their steak is also amazing. They have a very unique atmosphere perfect for a date!

Everything was great in terms of selection within the menu from wine to food. We had done the happy hour and it was a challenge to find 2 seats, let alone 1 seat for the hour we stood there. 

The steak over bruschetta was the only dish I did not like. Not really steak but the fat trimmed off and placed over bruschetta with a lot of Parmesan cheese. Wish the menu had specified that or the waiter/bartender. Every dish ordered had a lot of Parmesan cheese which took the Flavor away from the main entree. It was also interesting to see it on top of all the dishes ordered. 

Over good food and ambiance, just some items to be improved upon.

name: Emmer & Rye
address: SkyHouse, 51 Rainey St UNIT 110, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: Best dinner we had in Austin. Sat at the chef bar. Cool to watch the kitchen while you eat. Every single dish we had was excellent. A party in your mouth. Standouts - nettle pasta, pork shoulder, lions mane mushrooms, Johnny cakes. Great cocktails too. If you are into quality over quantity, don’t miss this place.

Died and went to Heaven!  We lucked out and sat at chef’s table.  We were delighted by countless taste combinations and “small plates”. The waiter explained everything and was very knowledgeable about menu.  This is a special place and we will highly recommend it to anybody visiting Austin.   The BEST!

Entirely underwhelmed by the food served to us last night. The shrimp salad contained possibly the smallest, most measly shrimp we had ever seen, sat in a puddle of water as if defrosted on the plate, swiftly soaked furthermore in a cream sauce leaving us both feeling rather sick. The steak tartare was, at best, average and the portion sizes of each dish were quite unbelievably poor. We tried an avocado on toast which looked as though it had been going round on the tray for a few hours. The oysters similarly did not appear appetizing. Despite the politeness of the staff as they presented their pitch, and the nice ambience of the setting, I found the experience almost insulting. We had to cancel our final dish as we did not wish to continue further, we had seen enough. We paid our bill at $115 and left hungry and disappointed. The staff did give us a cork for our wine and 5 slices of bread in a bag as an apology, and we ventured on to find more sufficient food elsewhere.  I can only assume that a) the culinary team were having a bad day or b) the other people leaving reviews are not particularly experienced in good quality tapas and dim sum. I hate to leave a bad review like this, but we both felt quite compelled to leave our honest thoughts on the experience. If you try it out, I hope they prove you otherwise.

What a great experience. From friendly, accommodating hostess to a wonderful server Megan S. They made our girls trip memorable. Food was delicious and great recommendations from our server. She may honestly be the friendliest and most accommodating server I’ve had in all of my years. Thank you so much for a great experience!!!

Best dinner we had while visiting Austin. Servers are knowledgeable and each dish is complex as they were delicious. The dim sum cart concept really didn't work here, but otherwise service was fantastic. The mole pork shoulder was the standout dish - flavorful and perfectly cooked.

name: Terry Black's Barbecue
address: 1003 Barton Springs Rd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: Terry Black's BBQ on Barton Springs is phenomenal!  I have never tasted better BBQ!  Their ribs are to die for, and everything else is, too.  Their sides are great, and they have green salad for those who may be vegetarians.  The thing that makes this restaurant unique is the way they treat their clientele, who come from all over the world to eat there.  The entire staff is friendly, and despite the crowd that is always there, they recognize their "regulars," and genuinely appreciate their patronage.  There is a line, but the way it is set up, the line moves quickly.  The atmosphere is happy, and you meet interesting people from everywhere! It's an experience to eat there, which is why we go every week!  The owners, twin brothers Mark and Michael, have set such a positive tone with their employees that they love working there, and the mood emanates throughout the crowd.  I wouldn't eat BBQ anywhere else!

Over the many trips to Austin I have enjoyed great barbecue. Terry Blacks is among the very best. This was my first time the food was delicious. The brisket was perfect and the sausage was awesome. When I return I will try the beef rib as one of the members of my team enjoyed that immensely. Hats off to the entire team for their excellent work and craftsmanship in the art of barbecue.

“Brisket is king” and the beef rib is Emperor of the BBQ galaxy! Oh sweet baby Jesus is it delicious! Traditional Central TX BBQ with a slight upscale flair in decor. One of the best BBQ experiences I’ve ever had. Try the mini pecan pie for a dessert! (((eye rolling into back of my head))).

Hands down the best BBQ restaurant I've ever eaten from. Everything from the brisket, to the pork ribs, to the sausage was amazing. I will say their mac n cheese could use a little work; it was somewhat bland and could use more seasoning but their pinto beans and potatoe salad was amazing... A little pricey but well worth it.

One of the best Barbecue experiences I've ever had. prices are expensive but it is more than Worth the price. Probably the best Brisket I've ever had and the Beef Rib is massive and just everything is amazing. Even the sides were better that I thought They would be. highly recommend going for any reason. There's constantly a long line, so get there early For a shorter long line.

name: Dai Due
reviews: Waters were brought to the table quickly and the server returned quickly to take our drink and appetizer order as well. The line list is expansive but also just a tad on the pricier side which IMO can be excused due to the large selection. Waitress was also reasonably knowledgeable about her wines and was able to assist us in making a choice. We ended up waffling between two different bottles so she kindly offered to bring us a small taster of each to help push us over the edge.

My partner requested this restaurant for his birthday dinner last week, so we ordered it to go.  I got the pork chop and green salad, he got the wagyu burger with beets.  It was excellent; my only regret was that we couldn't dine there.  And my dog LOVED me for sharing the pork chop fat and bone.

Came here for brunch and would definitely love to come back for lunch or dinner. Brunch has a good mix of savory or sweet and breakfast or lunch items. We had pancakes, tamales, a pastry, and a pigs in a blanket kind of roll. Everything was delicious! The pancakes had a great crisp crust but light and fluffy inside with a delicious honey and orange syrup topped with fresh cream. The tamale was incredible filled with wild boar and wrapped in collard greens, also they had a great green hot sauce that went perfect. The pastry was also delicious, light and fluffy. The other pastry was incredible with a venison sausage with so much flavor.

A restaurant which also sells locally sourced meat, most of the items on the menu is locally sourced as well. It is surely pricey, brunch average is $15 per person plus any additional for drinks. Service was okay, a tad slow. Serves dinner as well. Had the Biscuit and Gravy with venison sausage, the gravy was lacking kick, venison was a bit on the dry side. Biscuit could have been softer, will give it another shot and try something else on the menu the next time.

The staff was super knowledgeable and everything was meticulous. I will say that things were quite a bit smokey for my liking. Even the restaurant itself felt smokey... the cocktails alone made it worthwhile though!

name: Wink
address: 1014 N Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78703, USA
reviews: As this place is allowing only takeout and curbside delivery, my review really only concerns the ordering and food that I had a chance to enjoy. Very friendly service and easy to find while driving along N Lamar Blvd. I ordered online using the URL on a sign outside the restaurant. No problems. I live downtown, so it was just a short bike ride to get there, but there is also parking. My food was waiting for me shortly afterwards and had a chance to enjoy their delicious burgers! Glad they’re open during these times!

We’ve been meaning to eat at Wink for some time now, because it’s been years since we’ve eaten there. It’s no wonder that in a brutally competitive restaurant scene like Austin’s, that Wink is still in business. We were with another couple, all 4 of our appetizers were beautiful and delicious, and our entrees were on point. And to make our meal even more memorable was the service we received from Nicole. It was above and beyond, and it’s so obvious that she truly enjoys her job. I even told her so. After our meal, we decided to skip dessert and an after dinner drink, but Nicole treated us to a round of port and 3 desserts to share. We were all blown away. She’s a credit to the service industry and to Wink as well. We’ll definitely be dining there again soon, and we’ll be certain to request Nicole. I highly recommend this restaurant and our lovely server.

One of the few Austin places you can bring your own wine, with a small corkage fee. 

Recently did the 7 course tasting menu with a group of friends.

All of the food with wonderful, but the service was a bit slow tonight... which isn't the norm for this place.

The highlight of the tasting was the duck breast. Perfectly seasoned and cooked, easily in the top 3 duck dishes I've ever had and the best in Austin.

Super memorable date night. My husband and I first had drinks at the wine bar then walked over to the restaurant side for dinner. We had the 7 course tasting menu with wine pairings and had the most wonderful experience. The food and service was fantastic.

No other word but fantastic.  I am very disappointed in myself for not visiting this amazing place sooner.  My friend and I ventured here one summer Saturday evening and had our socks clearly blown off of our feet. There have been a barrel of "over hyped" restaurants in Austin lately, and let me assure you , this is not one of them. From the time we entered their wine bar for a glass before dinner, to when we left the restaurant, we were in a  foodie paradise.  We opted for the 5 course meal without the wine pairing, which was a mistake we will not be making again.  Every course was better than the last.  The most impressive part?
