Everything was made for the menu, that day. That's right, daily rotating menus. The creativity and production of the kitchen is magnificent. The portions were handled with ease, but by the end of the meal you didn't feel hungry; but you didn't want the tastings to stop.  The wine bar adjacent has a speakeasy feel, but that quickly dissolves to a exuberant atmosphere when you began a conversation with the lovely people behind the pine. Everyone was simply delightful.  It has been a long time since I've found so much enjoyment, and charm from a first time visit to a restaurant .  I cannot wait to go again!

name: Contigo
reviews:
I came here for New Year's Eve party and was not disappointed. For the price of admission, there was a buffet and open bar. 

All of the food was amazing, vary tasty. The open bar cocktails were perfectly be made with premium alcohol. 

To end the night, they provided tacos to go which came in really nicely after all the drinking.

One of my absolute favorite brunch spots in Austin. Weekend brunch starts at 10, and we never have trouble getting a table right away. Dishes are the perfect serving size, and while the menu is relatively small, there’s a little something for everyone, from the picky eaters to the foodie enthusiasts.

Great for parties. This was our first visit and we had a group of eight of all ages. The service was fast, especially the drinks and now I have a new favorite cocktail, Hell or High Water. Definitely coming back to have an entree because I filled up on snacks and had too much fun to care.

Overall I was disappointed in the experience here for brunch. We came with a large group and the food was fine, it was displayed beautifully but the pork Benedict was a little salty and the pork inside was mushy. The bloody Mary’s are just okay but certainly not the best I’ve had in Austin. Based on the reputation of this place I expected the food and service but it to be better but it certainly wasn’t bad. The service was a little slow considering it wasn’t busy while we were there. While I’d also like to try this place for dinner it is no longer a top priority.
Great atmosphere. Excellent service. The burger I had was amazing. We will definitely be back. Can’t recommend it enough.

name: Botticelli's
address: 1321 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: Food is excellent quality! Great authentic Italian food at a reasonable cost! The bread they serve as an appetizer is no ordinary bread! It’s full of meats and grilled veggies and dipped in their amazing marinara sauce that is served warm!!!! Great customer service and overall great experience! I’ll

The food was excellent, from antipasto to dessert. We had the best, most vivacious waitress as well. The outdoor section was in the shade and cool. If that is not your speed, the indoors had air conditioning. They were setting up for live music, but we left before it started.

I was here over the Thanksgiving hoilday with my wife and daughter who lives in Austin the service the atmosphere, was very nice the food absolutely wonderful ! A very good variety of dishes to choose from , our experience was very good and when I'm visiting Austin again I'm sure to visit Botticelli's again and I would recommend others to do so also. Highly recommended this cozy restaurant. Friendly service. The lasagna and carbonara with chicken was excellent. We would suggest the beet Napoleon salad to start - unique and full of flavor!
Great Italian food. Nice service. Prices a bit steep.

The good : The food was delicious, but you can't really go wrong with Italian food. But not good enough to justify the price tag. Expect to pay $30 a head before alcohol. The drinks were okay, strong but like the food also very expensive.

The bad : The restaurant was hot and humid inside. It felt like a sauna, and when we mentioned it to the hostess on the way in, she said that she would talk to the owner about it because they were worried it was too cold outside. There was literal steam on the windows and they never cut the AC on. It's a very tiny restaurant and the kitchen is right next to all of the tables.

This review is my opinion, and should be taken with a grain of salt as all opinions should be.

name: III Forks
reviews: good dinner, good service in fun upscale setting.  This place is highly rated in downtown Austin. I went recently and had a good meal.  Service was friendly and old school but great.   my bone in rib-eye was done just right. came with bread too.  my caesar was good but not great. onion rings great.  Priced fairly also. Well worth checking out.

We held a dinner meeting here and were extremely pleased. Emily helped us plan the event and was professional, responsive and attentive. She is truly exceptional! The room was beautiful and everything was set-up on time. They had an IT team that ensured all the equipment was working. The wait staff - Mick, Kimberly and Nick were fantastic. They were professional, friendly and meticulous with details. I would not hesitate to hold an event here in the future!

A must-eat for anyone looking to woo clients, experience high class Austin, or try some of the best steak in the city.  With a choice of booths to bar stools to tables with a lake view, you will have a wonderful dining experience that the waiters ensure a wonderful experience.  No matter the reason for your visit Three Forks will impress on all fronts, however be warned- the faucets hot water will get to boiling extremely quickly- so be careful when washing up.

We picked up our curbside order for Easter meal and it was amazing!  Everything was so delicious and well  worth the price.  I always enjoy celebrating our anniversary at III Forks and once again they did an excellent job on this Easter menu.  Thank you for making this Easter a memorable one.

Probably the best filets we’ve ever had. You must top it off with the King’s Crown! The lobster was cooked perfectly. Waiters are very attentive and helpful- top notch. The only reason for the rating of 4 is due to the unpleasant odor right as you walk in the doors, but I didn’t notice it after we were seated. My friend, however, was sensitive to it throughout our meal. Still, we would definitely dine here again.

name: Cypress Grill
address: 4404 W William Cannon Dr, Austin, TX 78749, USA
reviews: We really enjoy the seafood gumbo appetizer and, for dessert, the bread pudding. We always look forward to the holiday season because they do a special pumpkin bread pudding which is incredible! If you're not into seafood or Cajun food, the pot roast is fantastic. Great selection of oh so tasty food. Excellent service with a fun atmosphere. This is probably our favorite place in Austin.

To go margarita kit is awesome🤠👍👍. 

Makes a STRONG rita. Very good, This is a semi sweet rita. My advice is to ask for double or triple the "simple syrup" or add an additional 1 1/2 oz of fresh squeezed lime juice.  Their kit includes only 2 oz of the simple syrup.  
This kit by the oz:
3 1/2 oz tequila
1 3/4oz gran gala
2oz simple syrup. 
Add 1 1/2 oz fresh lime and make it less sweet🤠. See photos

Pretty good food and atmosphere. It was a pretty busy time of day. They get a pretty good crowd through there during Sunday brunch. Service was expected during such a busy time. Food was prompt and good. The crawfish egg rolls were pretty good!!

I sent my friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is yummy and the crew is welcoming and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we pass a pleasing evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

Me and the hubs decided to give this place a try for our date night out. We will definitely eat here again. The service was fantastic, the drinks were fabulous, and the food was so tasty. I had an old fashion to drink (the perfect amount of sweet and citrus), the red beans and rice for an "app", and the small portion of fried catfish. Everything had so much flavor and was cooked to perfection. You can tell they soak the catfish prior to frying. It was so moist and super flavorful. But YOU HAVE to try the red beans and rice. We even got a side to go to eat the next day. Thanks for a wonderful date night!!!

name: la Barbecue
address: 2027 E Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews:
Hands down the best bbq I've ever eaten. The line at 11:30 took until 1pm to get food but it was worth it. The brisket had amazing melt in your mouth flavor. Each slice had an incredible smoke ring and it was so savory and rich. The pork ribs were sweet and tangy from the sauce but so amazing. The pulled pork had nice depth and flavor and the two types of sausage had great texture and depth without trying to overload your pallet. The shells and cheese side was really good. The only things that didn't knock my socks off were the turkey and side of beans. The turkey was really good, being moist and flavorful but it lacked a deep smoky flavor I had hoped for. The beans were also good, but didn't feel write-home about. 

Again, this was the best BBQ I've ever had. I would gladly try any and all of what we ordered again (and again, and again)!

Wow! That was the best sliced brisket sandwich I've had in my life! Best barbecue I've had in Austin in 7 years. Perfect flavor, moist, tender, flavor of the meat stands out and doesn't get drowned between the bread, sauce, and condiments. Will add pictures tomorrow when I return for more brisket!

Waited 1.5 hours on Saturday morning Feb 29, and the food was definitely worth the wait!  Best brisket of the three places in town we tried that weekend, and best pork rib I've ever had in my LIFE!  Turkey breast was also juicy and tasty, and the pulled pork was good. They let us try a wee sample of this and that which helped our ordering. We would return!

So worth the wait.

Get here early, they open at 11 am, but we got here at 11:15 and waited for almost an hour and a half. First time to Texas, and while I haven't had the most experience with BBQ, this was definitely my favorite. Come with time to spare, make some friends, and order a beer in line and enjoy the wait before demolishing some delicious meat.

Must orders: Brisket, Beef Ribs (if they aren't sold out), and some sides (always pickles) and put yourself willingly into a delicious food coma.

Some local friends brought us and we all enjoyed the food. This place is very popular and ran out of much of the menu. This was my second visit and the preordering is the way to go. I don't understand the appeal in waiting in line for 2 hours if you have a choice. We had the brisket and then ate the beef rib. Both were smokey and tender and a good balance of protein and fat.

name: Eddie V's Prime Seafood
reviews:
I love this place!  It is consistently wonderful!  They have the best servers and waitstaff who really know how to make each visit a unique and special experience.  I went with a group of 4 friends to celebrate a birthday.  The hostess  asked if we were celebrating anything special upon our arrival and to our surprise when we were seated at our table there was a birthday card which had been signed by the waitstaff.  There were also fresh rose petals scattered along the middle of our table along with a candle.  

After having a delicious meal with cocktails, we decided to splurge and order the bananas foster to share.  In addition to the dessert we ordered (which had Happy Birthday beautifully written on it), the restaurant treated us to a second complimentary smaller bananas foster for the birthday girl. It was incredibly decadent and a very generous and sweet gesture.   

If you are looking for a special night out, or simply delicious food in a delightful atmosphere, this is your place.  I come here as often as I can.  Thanks for your great food and service!

I went to Bristol on a business lunch last week and it was quite impressive. The wait staff was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. I would recommend getting an entree from the "fresh catch" section of the menu. All of the fish on the section is flown in (never frozen) and you can really taste the difference. The sides were all delicious and great. It's a bit pricey, but you're paying for high quality food and it is well worth it!
This place is fantastic!  Never disappoints.  I highly recommend the Bone-in Filet and the Bananas Foster Butter Cake will be among the best dessert you've ever had.

Had dinner at the other location last week. Great experience but not the best. This week, we had New Year's Eve dinner at this location. Perfectly wonderful! Our server, Krystal, was amazing. She was professional yet personable and she made our experience perfect. The food was amazing, as always. We had the Chilean sea bass, half a dozen oysters, the Fuji apple salad, Au Gratin potatoes and the absolutely wonderful bananas foster cake. Everything was so good! The drinks were also much better than the other location. The bartender really knows how to make a drink. I had an amazing lemon drop. This will be the only location we visit when we come to Austin. Eddie V's is still my favorite restaurant in the world.

Incredible! We started with happy hour. The bartender was knowledgeable and friendly and the cocktails he concocted were just what the doctor ordered. For dinner, I had the king crab and lobster bisque. We started with the shellfish tower. Try the truffle Mac and cheese, it was the hit if the night! Be careful, this place is PRICEY. But for a one time treat, go big. We loved every minute. Highly recommended!

name: Hillside Farmacy
reviews: Always love Hillside Farmacy. First time not going for brunch, and the high quality of food is of course not lost! I would give the burger itself a 4/5 as the patty was just slightly lacking in flavor. The fries on the other hand were absolutely incredible!! Some of the best I’ve had in recent memory. The Brussels sprouts were out of this world and the sautéed greens were delicious as well. 4 stars only because this time around the service was a little bit sub-par.

Amazing everything. The experience was super lovely. Staff very friendly, with a comfortable and clean establishment. The food was scrumptious. You won't leave without finishing off every crumb on your plate. Check this place out!

We are still talking about we can’t believe that everything was so good even 30 minutes later. We got a caesar salad, burger, the Trees Knees, and Hot Country Doctor. The last two were cocktails and both were amazing. We even asked the bartender how the Trees Knees was made

Parking is a mess but the pancakes makes up for it....so fluffy and rich.   Kale salad left me wanting a little something more...The biscuit gravy was delicious.  Dog friendly.  Clean and well kept bathrooms.  The bloody Mary, is a work of art...just look at the care they took to make it.
This place fits right in with the Austin feel. Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Must try the fried green tomatoes egg sandwich, it's so good.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
reviews: If you want a world class case of the meat sweats after dinner this is your place. Tender cuts of delicious beef and pork and don't ignore the chicken. Try it out you'll go home happy and full! Convenient valet parking out front. Friendly and attentive staff.

Oh my goodness this is my favorite place in the whole wide world. Our experience was amazing. Everyone was so professional and nice to us. We came to celebrate my promotion at work and we could have not picked a better place. We will be back in a couple of months to celebrate my birthday. Thank you so much for making our experience amazing!!!

It's definitely an experience. The meats are plentiful and they come out quickly, maybe not fast enough for a quick eater like myself but good enough. The salad bar is pretty good and expansive. The meats were delicious. They weren't so good that I'd spend this much money again to eat, but they were definitely good. Little bit on the salty side. Service overall was pretty good, although we waited quite some time to get our bill.

The fresh meats just kept coming to the table. You take what you want and decline the rest.  when you want them to stop offering new meat, turn your coaster over to the red side.  Ready for more?  Turn it back to the green side.  It was great. each person had a different type of meat that was freshly prepared and ready for serving.  There was also a huge market salad table with so many options You could eat just that and still be very full.  The homemade Brazilian flan was fantastic!

We came for lunch and choose the breakfast/brunch buffet option. The buffet is comprehensive, is very fresh and of noticeable quality. For a protein option I opted for the Sausage and that maybe the best sausage I have eaten. I had decided on mineral water to drink but once I had tasted the spicy sausage I knew it begged a Mendoza Malbec. The house labelled wine was a 2017, very young, and it is going to be very drinkable in 3 - 4 years. Right now this wine is very closed but the potential is excellent. The service was exceptional. I really enjoyed this restaurant right down to the traditional dress being worn. I  can't wait to go again and try a steak.

name: Comedor
reviews:
We had heard so many great things about the Comedor that I was concerned our first visit wouldn't live up to the hype. I am so glad to report the experience not only met our expectations, it exceeded them.

We were fortunate to have the weather cooperate, so sitting on the outdoor patio, on a cool, yet comfortable evening added to the experience. 

Service was friendly, yet professional. We elected to sample tapas style allowing for each dish to come out as it was ready. My photos don't do justice to the tastes 😊

They earned their number one spot as best restaurant in Texas. Truly inventive and delicious. The chef is a genuine treasure, and the staff is stellar. Just look at this heavenly dessert!! The space and menu, and even the play list is thoughtfully and brilliantly designed. Meant for an intimate shared dining experience. So great!

Service is a solid 4 stars, bathrooms are 3, food and drinks are a 7 out of 5. Don't leave Austin with out visiting here, small plates are amazing as is the wine list. Cocktails alone are worth a visit. Small plates are where the action is on the menu, they are all amazing, put your focus there and you'll leave happy. Expect to pay about $100 per person, inclusive of drinks.

Beautiful vibes. Gorgeous light on the inside. Love the simple and dark design. The food is delicious. We went with some pros, so I didn’t have to order anything, but everything that was brought out was amazing. Staff was kind and stylish. 10/10 would return. Ps - I never thought I would eat a bone marrow taco 🌮 and love it... yet here we are (drool... 🤤) Don’t leave without ordering that dish.

Amazing and worth the visit. Make a reservation in advance, unless you can find a spot at the bar for happy hour (which I need to attend soon). Great atmosphere and environment with a focus on specialty cocktails and exquisite food. Their most popular dish is the bone marrow tacos which we ordered. Loved the margaritas they made, ordered spicy margs and enjoyed. The only pitfall we had was the reservation we made was for the patio. However, when we got there they said the patio was full. Either way, specialty restaurant for special occasions.

name: Hoover's Cooking
reviews: That ham steak with Jezebel sauce was delicious.  Everything tasted awesome.  Clean bathroom, nice staff and home cooking....great way to be welcomed back into Austin.  Nice selections of cobblers.  Open til 10pm which is also great on a Tuesday if your plane gets in late.

I don't come here often but need to start coming more often. Service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious. They have many side options and I love that they give you three! They also have special sides do don't forget to look at the chalk board.

I haven't tried the BBQ yet but I will next time. 

There is plenty of parking.

What can I say. That chicken from the smokehouse was on point. Perfect smoke, flavor, and just falling off the bone good. Service was excellent. Aaron was on time and on target with the service. You guys have something good going here, obviously. I travel all over the world and this place just became a top shelf spot to visit while in Austin. Keep it up.

Atmosphere: Country diner

Service: Friendly and quick 

Food: Chicken fried chicken was on-point and a very generous serving. We opted for mashed potatoes and cream gravy (perfect) and fried okra (soggy breading). Corn muffins and strange spiced biscuits were okay. Banana pudding cheesecake was a decadent innovation.

Pricing: $36.00 for above with 2 teas

Large portions. Down home cooking with a twist. Some kick and spice to most dishes. (Edited to say) And the food? Outstanding. We used to eat at the one at Anderson Mill and were so disappointed when it closed years ago. My office was beside it and needless to say I was a regular. You can't go wrong. I can only say hurry up. What are you waiting for?

name: Clark's Oyster Bar
reviews: Atmosphere was great. Staff was pleasant and courteous. Quality of food was excellent. Presentation and taste were on point. Highly recommend and well worth the price point. Great cold bar and dessert selection! Kinda almost felt like I was in Martha’s Vineyard.

Amazing meal with amazing service. Impeccable place! Make sure to make a reservation! Nice place to enjoy lunch with friends. We were seated and greeted immediately. Our server was knowledgeable and helpful. The oyster selection is great as it has choices from a few different regions. I really enjoyed the sex on the bay oysters. And the shaved horseradish, wow! I would recommend the dressed oysters as well. The flavoring was divine. I especially loved their salads and the lobster roll. Their matchstick fries were so crispy and plentiful. Can't wait to go back!

Delightful neighborhood oyster bar + seafood joint. Portions are on the smaller side though they make it up in flavor and texture. The roasted cauliflower with hazelnut and raisins was the highlight. As were the shoestring fries - the whole mountain of them! 
Service is great - server was friendly and food was served fairly quickly. Generally children-friendly.

The food is amazing. We change the oyster menu about 2 twice a day, so people have a variety to choose from. We get oysters from all over, but we don't have gulf oysters. My favorite oysters are Onset and Murder point. 

My favorite dishes from the hotline are crispy snapper and cioppino. The grits are really good. I also like the kale and brussel sprouts.

Oysters were AWESOME! Seafood is super fresh. Service was great by Scott. The boss with the big red beard was accommodating and very professional. Outdoor seating was peaceful and really comfortable. I highly recommend this place, especially if you need a good change of scenery. ALOHA.

name: Corner Restaurant & Bar
reviews:
Not bad. Music was pretty loud. I had the fried zucchini corn bread and a house salad. I asked for a different vinaigrette than the spicy, because I have a weak mouth, but the salad itself was spicy too, alas.

The salad required cutting. I've never had to cut my lettuce and croutons before, but they wouldn't even fit in my mouth otherwise. 

The fried zucchini corn bread was interesting. I could taste the grease from frying. Some honey or other topping may have improved the taste. It was nicely moist.

The greeter and waiter were both very friendly and attentive.

If you like loud music and spicy food, this may be the place for you. If you like quiet and "boring" food, maybe skip this place.

I had the crispy fish tacos which were amazing! The chipotle sauce is on the side which is a good thing because it had kick. Appetizers we good. We got the nachos and three dips and they even refilled the nachos for us. Our server was excellent.  Overall great time

Traveling around the downtown area of Austin, this bar totally caught our eye! Bartenders Joe and Dave were super attentive from the second we sat down. We ordered the Bacon and Spinach salad which was one of the best salads we have ever had, and the Short rib nachos. The bartenders were very knowledgeable about the cocktails and food! Great ambience too!

We came to corner for a girls night out and it was the perfect spot! Great location downtown, super clean environment, good crowd. I had the salmon and it was cooked perfectly. Our server Chelsea was super accommodating, giving us good recs for the city. She had the most upbeat attitude and made our dining experience that much more enjoyable, we will miss her!!

The highlight of my visit here were the 3 dips and chips appetizer. Seriously, check it out. Really nice interior and various seating areas. While the app was good, the entree I ordered was good but not exactly notable. I will be returning sometime for dinner and I'll update my review when I do, but as of now I would just say the food isn't anything to write home about.

name: Roaring Fork
reviews: We had a great meal and the service was very good too. We have visited before and every time the food has been consistent well prepared. I will say it is pretty expensive, but I think when you decide to eat on Congress Avenue you probably should expect to help pay for the high rent. I enjoyed soup, salad and a cocktail. Cliff was helpful with making suggestions, super attentive and a great server.

Invited by coworkers to eat here. Customer service was good. Seated quickly & drink orders quickly taken. Customer service was decent. Food served hot and was nicely seasoned, and tasted good. Prices were expectedly in the high range, but food of high quality. Nice meal. Only downside was the restaurant was dark and it was very hard to read the menus.

Great atmosphere, white table cloths and candles kind of place, but very welcoming to a couple of travelers in tee shirts and shorts. 
Wait staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. I definitely recommend the salmon. The fish tacos were good as well. A must try in downtown Austin.

Loved our after Valentine's day, Valentine's celebration.  This downtown restaurant had an a amazing menu. The steak was prepared perfectly.  But surprisingly the guacamole was one of the best we've had!  Server was very helpful and kept our glasses full. It was definitely a great night out.

We had a phenomenal time at the Roaring Fork.  The food was delicious and flavorful.  We had the best waiter Cliff attending to our table.  He was on top of it from start to end offering suggestions on what to try on the menu.  Everything that was brought out was delicious.  The burgers are giant, so bring your appetite.  The green chili Mac and cheese is delicious and very cheesy.  If you’re a dessert person you definitely want to try to pecan pie, the peach pie was amazing also.  Next time I’m here I’ll definitely return.

name: Bufalina Pizza
address: 1519 E Cesar Chavez St #200, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews: The food is five-star for this kind of resto, it's a fun, laid-back place to eat but our server was having a bad day (although previous reviews have noted service attitude issues). The pizzas and salads were excellent, and it's clearly a regular spot for locals. We'd definitely go back for the food and hope for a more gracious server. We were introduced to Bufalina this weekend by our son in Austin. Excellent Pizza and a wonderful wine selection. We will definitely be back and have already sent out a recommendation to our foodie friends. Add it to your list.

Great pizza and wine spot! There is usually a wait, but it is well worth it (and you can have a glass outside while you wait). The pizza is cooked in a blazing hot wood fired oven that sits in the middle of the restuarant. On top of that, they have one of the best wine lists in Austin, and really know their stuff. Would definitely recommend!

Go early because the space is small and fills up fast. The apps, pizza, and wine are all amazing. The service is fast and very friendly. The only drawback to this location is the noise level when the restaurant is full. The chef let us try a dessert tart that isn’t on the menu yet... and it was a solid finish to a great dinner.

The pizzas from here give a NYC pizza a run for its money! And it’s right here in Austin. The sauce is rich and tangy, and the decor is casual but fancy at the same time. The firing oven is right in the sitting area so you can watch your pizza being made while you sip one of their wines. Good place for friend meet ups, having a birthday dinner, or a sweet date.
One of best pizzas I ever had! Nice selection of wine, great desert, quite a bit of waiting (we waited an hour on Friday night).

name: Rosewood
reviews: Rosewood is great! We had a work dinner here and reserved the outdoor patio and it was perfect! Our team enjoyed spending time together playing the games Rosewood had outside. The weather was perfect and they took great care of us! They’re food was unique and delicious! Please go enjoy this beautiful restaurant!

Wonderful location that seems to breath at brunch rather than suffocate. Food is spotty with odd beignets swimming in a bourbon sauce but then a great fried chicken sandwich and delightful breakfast of eggs. 

Go for the atmosphere and be alert to the menu fluctuations.

Recently ordered their fried chicken dinner to break up the monotony of cooking at home during quarantine. Ordered the night before and received a prompt and courteous confirmation from Jeb the next day. Fried chicken was juicy and delicious. The greens and potato salad were tasty 😋 They are also selling produce that we will look at next time. Thanks!
A unique atmosphere that was inviting and fun. Made for a lovely night out with friends and co-workers. I highly recommend if you want a more relaxing night out with amazing food and service.

Tasting menu!!!! It changes daily and we had a wonderful time enjoying then anticipating our next dish. The home itself has a very interesting history. We want to try the picnic basket on the lawn and brunch next!

name: Péché
reviews:
Visiting from Dallas and wanted a place to get yummy cocktails. It was suggested we come here, and boy are we happy we listened. 

If your just getting drinks, sit at the bar, the bartenders are great company. The drinks are delicious and unique. Prices are reasonable for what you get. Keep in my this to not 6th St. You're gonna pay more than $5 for a drink. But you're not going to get gut rot the next morning.

The old fashioned is fantastic. Made the correct way with a large ice cube and strong. It's our go to beverage to see the quality of the bartender and the restaurant.

I also had an adult milkshake. YUM! You really can't go wrong here.

We didn't eat any food, but it all looked delicious as it passed us by.

The drinks were fantastic.  The bar has everything you could imagine.  The bartenders are incredibly personable and experienced, and like what they do.  The food was well intentioned but the execution was a tiny bit off.  I get that it's Friday and all so that might have been it.  I do need to mention the food came out perfectly timed and the restaurant has great ambiance  too
I came here with a friend for their milkshake that has alcohol in it. I suggest the Grasshopper if you like mint. It’s really good. I went around happy hour.

Great atmosphere. Wonderful service even though we came in a big group with kids. 
They have the best Mac and Cheese, even the adults loved it.

The drinks are usually great. The burger is good but can sometimes be overcooked (all 3 were this time). I do love the French onion soup and the Mac and cheese. 
Service at the tables is less than mediocre, and actually completely apathetic. Definitely sit at the bar!

name: Chez Nous
reviews: Love. Love. Love this place! Great customer service. Great ambiance. Food is ALWAYS delicious. They split our meal for us too. We ordered Escargot, wine and New Zealand Lamb Chops.

Very Nice atmosphere . Did remind me of France. Quaint, food simple, well prepared. All waiters are waiting on you and service was fast! I came because of the other reviews and that the owner answers all of them personally!!! Impressive. I had the trout. It was light, which is good, watching my weight. Needed a little salt. That’s ok. Much worse if the food is salty.

Really surprised by this place.  It has the authenticity and feel of an old school mom and pop shop with the caliber of food from a high end restaurant in an unassuming and genuine package.  It's a small and cozy place has much more intimacy than most of the other restaurants in Austin that I've been.  Great service and wine selection.  I'll definitely be back.

The food was really good. I really enjoyed the crème brulee. Be ready to wait some time during pick hours. The good thing is that they call you when a table is available so you can go look around if you want.

This was a very fun family activity. One thing that I was suggest would be to lower the prices a bit, because I don’t think that the price is worth how longer than they are and what you’re doing. If you were to go it just a little bit may be 10 or $15 per person I think you to get more business.

name: Caroline Restaurant
address: 621 Congress Ave Suite 101, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: Great happy hour for brunch and lunch! Had a coffee and a free raspberry danish. The happy hour drink feature was a blood orange margarita. Loved the quality and prices. The bar area was clean, comfortable, and beautiful. Staff were cordial.

I usually avoid hotel restaurants if at all possible, but Caroline was great. This was the best fried chicken and waffles I've ever had, as the chicken skin was extra crispy while the meat was moist. The waffle was fluffy and served with sides of both syrup and honey butter. I also had a tomatoes, olive oil and sea salt side that was on the pricey side, but well worth it.

The biscuits and gravy was an amazing mid afternoon brunch. Perfect amount of crunch and softness to the biscuits. The gravy had sausage and ham which was delicious. The poached eggs were perfection on my plate but a little over done on my friends plate. Over all a great experience. It was beautiful to sit on the patio and people watch.
Trendy spot attached to the Aloft hotel with an upstairs and downstairs seating area. Clean and the staff are friendly. The food took a bit of time to arrive but the taste was worth the wait.
Wonderful food and Kevin was an amazing server. Portion size was great and I even have some left over. Definitely one of our favorite spots downtown.

name: Swift's Attic
reviews: We enjoyed lunch here. Both of us appreciated that the restaurant was quiet enough to hold conversation. Salads were perfect and I thoroughly enjoyed the lunch special which was a crab cake sandwich.

Really great V-day dinner at Swift’s. Cool, rustic decor upstairs and welcoming staff. The set menu for dinner had lots of nice options that all came out delicious and full of flavor. The manager noticed we only got one dessert at the end of our meal and brought us two to enjoy. They also brought a red rose to my girlfriend with the check so really made her feel special. Keep it up!

I love the cozy, warm wood tones and industrial metal accents. The decor though still doesn't stack up to how good the cocktails are. Everything is incredible and potent! A great places to relax and have a few drinks with friends without having to shout over crowd noise.

We ordered three appetizers and split two entrees and everything was amazing! Staff was great and ordered some drinks. I ordered their old fashion ice ball drink - best part, the ice melts and makes an old fashion slushy but if you add an extra shot you get two drinks.

This is an interesting restaurant that is an Asian fusion with a good mixture of options. 

I sat at the bar and the staff Zack and Sam were incredibly friendly. They switched off serving me and it took a little bit for me to get noticed as there is a pole in the center of the bar. Otherwise everything else was great!

The drinks were awesome, they had these great drinks where they take a variety of ingredients freeze it into a ball and then pour liquor on top! Over time the ball melts flavoring the drink, essentially allowing you to choose how strong you want the drink. They will also let you buy another liquor shot to top off the drink! So you get two drinks almost got the price on one. I got the strawberry ice ball and the Pimm's one. Both were good just in different ways. I also got another interim drink while I let one melt the was very good.

I had the calamari fries which were amazing. Think cut calamari lightly battered. Then I had the pork cheeks with sour dough, it was okay but lacked flavor, and finished with a desert. It was also very good.

I'd recommend stopping in, but if you want a table make sure to get a reservation!

name: Koriente
reviews:
This was a pleasant surprise! My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine’s Day expecting the regular sushi type restaurant with sushi prices. Turns out the sushi prices were nonexistent! We got bowls with unique oriental cuisine. I had the sushi and my boyfriend had the steak. Both were phenomenal with the spring roll! 

I also am a huge tea lover. They had loose leaf tea served in tea pots with however many cups you need! Every detail is amazing!

This place is a gem! Two people that have moved from Austin have told me that it’s the place they miss most - on separate occasions! It’s that perfect place to suggest when with a few friends and no one will make a decision, because it’s laid back, but still feels like “going out to eat”. The prices are hard to beat, location is fun for drinks afterwards. The best part besides the food- a flavor you can’t find anywhere else - is the people! The people are AMAZING, so friendly and positive, they brighten your day.
Hidden Gem in Austin. Upon entering, you feel the good energy. You can wait for your food or drinks while enjoying free soup

Wow. I'm glad we got there early because soon after we ordered and sat down there was a long line forming outside, which took people 15-20 minutes to get inside and order. The young lady taking orders at the counter was really nice, patient, and extremely helpful about my order. The food was really good. You get served a lot! I am definitely visiting again!
Fresh and delicious ingredients.  Consistently great food.  Awesome service.  Love coming here for lunch!

name: Fabi + Rosi
reviews: I checked this place out with a couple of friends of mine tonight. This is a very quaint and cute little place right across the street from deep Eddy dive bar. It's a super cute place and the food was very very good. I love their happy hour! I had a mushroom ravioli dish that I thought was absolutely amazing! The environment of the place was very nice and outdoor seating was quite pleasant. If you are as prone to mosquito bites as I am, ask the staff for some mosquito repellent. They have a ton of them! I would definitely come here again and I recommend this place!!
The restaurant has a great classic ambiance. I attended with a party and the service was good. They have a great menu and the food did not disappoint. The price is great as well.

Everything here was excellent. The only feedback I would have for the owner is to increase the sizes of the main courses. The Halibut was excellent but almost as small as an appetizer, in my opinion. The lobster risotto felt a little held back on the lobster for it's price. Other than that, it's a lovely place.

Well... this place has entered in contention for one of the best places to eat in Austin. I really enjoyed my meal here. Before I get to the food, I got to say that the restaurant space has an excellent vibe and really cute. Great space for a nice little night out on the town.

Exceptional. The menu isn't extensive but has just enough options to satisfy all palettes. I love that the meals are made from sustainable and locally sourced ingredients at a fair price. The warm and inviting ambiance of the restaurant is an added perk.

name: Café Josie
address: 1200 B W 6th St, Austin, TX 78703, USA
reviews: Really outstanding small plates. Lots of flavor in everything we ate. The roasted Brussell sprouts and wedge salad were perfect. We did the "Experience" and were absolutely stuffed afterwards. The mixed drinks were also expertly crafted.

There's a lot of things in life that I truly appreciate and one of them is great food. Cafe Josie has the most talented chefs in Austin. The food is unique, always served fresh, and the atmosphere makes for the perfect date night!

My wife and I came here for date night.  We both had The Experience which was amazing.  We tried 9 different dishes and loved all of them, but the pork belly, the brussel sprouts and the deviled eggs really stood out for us.  We normally love pork belly anyways, but the smell of the grill infused into the cauliflower confit provided this amazing balance to the pork belly.  I normally dislike eating brussel sprouts, but they roasted and seasoned these perfectly that I had two extra helpings.  Service was great and very attentive, bringing out the dishes as we were finishing other dishes so that we neither felt impatient nor rushed.  Over all it was a great evening, and if we had the opportunity to, we'd come back again.
Absolutely loved everything we tried! Excellent presentation and very flavorful and our server Mary was very pleasant. I am already looking forward to going back.

In a word, Cafe Josie is amazing! With 13 small plates to choose from, I think we tried everything - crudo, Brussels sprouts in a balsamic vinaigrette, fried oysters, short ribs, meatloaf, salmon, shrimp, and I can’t remember them all. The flavors all worked together and the staff incredibly friendly and helpful. We went with another couple to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we will be going back very soon. Highly recommend

name: Home Slice Pizza
address: 1415 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews:
Awesome pizza! This is my favorite place to go to in Austin. Several weeks back I got the white pie with spinach and the eggplant pizza and its was incredible! 
The only downside is that they allow kids at the bar. Hopefully that was a one time thing that I saw, but if not, that's bad business practice.

Service is outstanding and atmosphere is cozy yet fun. If there is a wait, I highly recommend going to the back patio and ordering the garlic knots. They are fantastic. We had a pizza and it was good, but not amazing. Overall, it’s a good place and you can tell it’s filled with locals.

We popped in to look and the host explained that there would be a lineup if we came back after five and besides “if you cone back before five I’ll still be here so you get to see me again.” Perfectly delivered -neither arrogant nor inappropriate- just fun and funny. It worked and when we returned a colleague was about to put us on the back patio (it was getting a little cool) she came running up and told her co-worker “I got this” and within seconds she had cleaned up a booth. It was more crowded after five not no lineup. If this is her “routine” I might be even more impressed. As for the food we went simple with pepperoni and mushroom- one word - fantastic! When they asked if we wanted our pizza boxed we said we’d rather it wrapped in foil for easy carrying. No problem.

This place is an amazing! The seating arrangement in the backyard is a perfect family style setting. The pizza slices are made fresh and they taste delicious. We ordered two different slices. Strongly recommend trying the house special pizza as well.
Sooooooo good. Crowded. Better to get and go. But there's nothing better than a slice of pizza from here while strolling on congress Ave.

name: DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana - Downtown Austin
address: 301 Lavaca St Suite 200, Austin, TX 78701, USA
reviews: A great place for pizza in downtown Austin! I came across this place while I was waiting for a bus one morning. Finally got around to trying it out a week later...delicious! Well, worth visiting a few more times to try out other selections! Parking is…well, it’s downtown parking. Easily seen along Lavaca St between W 3rd and 4th St. Friendly and great service!

We got the DeSano pizza, the crust was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside, charred to perfection! The crust had a good flavor, you could tell they used the best ingredients out there! The sauce had lots of flavor, the toppings were quality choice ingredients too! Do yourself a favor ... get the garlic butter to dip your crust in ... its great without it but with it it’s mindblowingly delicious! We also tried the meatballs and they tasted like a little old Italian lady had rolled them out by hand, they were so tender and juicy! Some of our party got salads and said they were tasty too! I highly recommend this pizza as the best I’ve had in Austin TX!

Amazing spot! Pizza was fantastic and I'm from Jersey! If you are in Austin and want some good pizza, come here. If you're from NYC and want pizza, come here! Chat with Nick; he'll tell you the real deal! Super helpful, cared about our experience and has an awesome sense of humor. Thanks for satisfying my pizza craving!!
Great atmosphere! Good pizza! Seating can be tight when they are busy. I ordered the Pepperoni Margherita Doppio and it was amazing. Will definitely be back in the future.

The tomatoes and Mozzarella cheese is my favorite. Some of the best pizza I have ever had right here. Everything tastes fresh, ingredients are shipped in from Italy. I highly recommend this place to anybody who wants some great pizza. Great Location right near Stay Za Za Hotel downtown. The pizza is indescribable and the service was superb, it's the best pizza experience I've had in Austin.  My favorite was the minced garlic at the condiments bar. I will definately go there again.

name: Z'Tejas
reviews: Our server Michael was great and attentive during our visit. He had great suggestions for food and drinks. Would definitely come back!
This was our first time to eat out publicly since quarantine and we had the best dinner experience! We felt super safe and our server, Michael, was amazing. Definitely coming back!!
Had a great time dining outside here. The drinks were amazing, food was delicious and our server, Michael, was excellent! Would recommend and will be back!
Food was really good!! Only issue was we are strict Vegetarian and they served beef in vegetable fajitas! If you eat non vegetarian you can get best food here
Great experience! Everyone was wearing masks and I saw them cleaning the chairs after each party. Michael was a great sever, very attentive!

name: Juan in a Million
address: 2300 E Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews:
Whether you live in Austin or just visiting, if you've never been to Juan In A Million, you need to do so! I recommend the Juan In a Million which is such a huge portion. It's a great place to start your day! 

I will say if you go during prime breakfast/brunch times, then you will have to wait. There isn't enough seating for the amount of people that come to this restaurant at one time so it will be a bit cramped. Parking may be hard too but they have a parking lot behind the restaurant and there is street parking, but those are obviously first come, first serve. 

This place is popular and it's a great price for the portion. I do hope they can expand their restaurant but other than that I do appreciate the authenticity of the place. Even though they've become super popular, they still keep it very simple.

Juan you definitely are one in a million along with staff. I felt like I was invited to your home and you brought out your best service,food and drinks. This was my first visit to Austin and this be a memorable experience. The food taste, quality and portions does not disappoint. I will definitely come back.

The food is pretty good. Definitely satisfied our desire for breakfast tacos. The Don Juan is, indeed, way too much food for 1 person and can be broken into 4 or 5 smaller tacos. The salsa is quite good, and the service is efficient. 
If you're looking for tasty food on a budget, or like the idea of buying local at mom/pop style places, this is a great choice. It is authentic Austin.

My boyfriend and I live in Houston but we love traveling to Austin. Our first stop is always Juan in a Million. The food and service is amazing. It feels like Home. My boyfriend always looks forward to the handshake and the Don Juan Taco. As soon as we can safely travel to Austin again, we will make sure to stop by Juan in A Million. Thank you.

Three of us shared the Don Juan Grande and a chorizo and egg taco. Both were so delicious! There’s so much flavor in the food. The tortilla chips they give you when you sit down are also really tasty. The service was great and everyone was friendly. I can see why they’re always so busy. Even if you see a long line at the front, don’t get discouraged. They move quickly. We waited about 10 minutes and it was very worthwhile.

name: Intero Restaurant
address: 2612 E Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78702, USA
reviews: Wow... wine selection was amazing. We went for a special Monday event so I can't comment on the food but other attendees were raving about it. We will return when restaurant is open to sample all the yummy offerings.  The menu looked amazing. Special class offered was fantastic!
Love Intero! Food and space is fantastic. Really approachable menu. The husband wife owners are great. My wife has a dairy allergy and they were more than accommodating.

Every bite, every meal, every experience, every single time...pure perfection. My husband and I have never not had a perfect night from start to finish here. Whether we're having date night, or with guests, it has always left us in awe. It's why we keep coming back. 
The service here raises the bar in Austin. Be sure to ask to sit in Theodore's section (we're pretty sure he has a cult following at this point).
Don't forget to pick up the chocolate works of art to take home...decadence like nowhere else.

Beautiful restaurant, great staff and incredible food, had an amazing time with my Girlfriend on are First Anniversary will staying in Austin. One drink I would recommend specifically is the: after apple-picking, sweet and ever so slightly sharp. Make shore to book ahead as can get busy. Plenty of space in the restaurant for a romantic setting and private conversation.

Welcome to the east side Intero! A great little spot with an even greater happy hour menu ($2 off any drink and half price bar food) from 4:30-6:30. 

We have slowly gone through almost every item on the bar menu in two visits. The wine selection is really nice - they carry different varietals that pique your curiosity. The cocktail menu has it going on while the friendliness of your bartender is hit or miss. Our first visit we had a very engaging and informative bartender that made our first experience a great one. The second time our bartender only responded with “uh huhs” and didn’t seem too enthused to be there. Come on folks, that’s why people like sitting at the bar because we wanna engage!

The food quality is high, the flavors are great even with items I tend not to like - in fact, my favorite dish thus far has been the roasted cauliflower! The white bean dip is another favorite. Their hand made pastas are good (the actual pasta could be better as sometimes they are over cooked), but the ingredients and sauces are superb. All in all, a good food experience. 

We are hoping our next trip doesn’t include the grouchy bartender.

name: Andiamo Ristorante
reviews: Went this hidden gem last night with my family and ordered some plates and shared family style. The food and service was amazing. Great date spot as well. Don't forget to order the Gelato. It was amazing!

Amazing bread! Rolled with spices. I had the summer menu pasta - squid ink pasta with octopus. Fantastic! Great flavor and not overly sauced. The spaghetti carbonara was also amazing with flavor from the Guanciale (pork cheek bacon). Highly recommend.

We had never been here before and weren't sure what to expect when we arrived. The location wasn't what we expected when we booked reservations as it's in a small strip mall and the inside is much smaller than what we were expecting. 

I took my girlfriend here for dinner the night I proposed (she said yes!) and the food was absolutely delicious! We actually forgot about drinking our wine because of the food quality being so high!  The wine pairing was very descriptive too with some great suggestions from our waiter. Very professional wait staff, great food, and the interior was nicely remodeled as well. I would suggest this place for sure! All around a great experience.

Don't let the strip mall location fool you. The food took me back to Italy! The tastes are amazing, the service is excellent and the atmosphere is nice. I had two specials for the day, the salad and the swordfish. Both cooked to perfection. Delicious! The wine list also took me back to Italy. A wide variety of Italian wine is offered. The Branchini sangiovese went perfectly with the food. Thank you Andiamo for a lovely dinner!!!

Wonderful, authentic Italian food made with love. I could say more, but you should try it for yourself! I especially like their seasonal changes. Right now they're serving an incredible pumpkin ravioli and seafood penne. Their garlic bread is also the BEST in town!

name: Elizabeth Street Cafe
reviews: This place is pretty insane. The food was prepared and served super fast and super quick. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The pork belly is from local pigs who h is cool. Will tell everyone who will listen to go here when in the neighborhood.

This is a must try while in Austin!  We tried the French toast and banana Nutella crepe and OH MY so good! Also had their white tea and it was very tasty. Didn’t get to go back to try their lunch but wish I had.

Super fresh, creative and friendly in a warm and attractive environment. The combination of traditional French and traditional Vietnamese cuisine together is brilliant. Where else can you get a perfect croissant AND pork belly with vermicelli cake for breakfast? Terrific!

What a pleasant surprise! We absolutely loved this place. We sat outside because inside seemed stuffy. I loved the mango salad. Great flavor. I was less enamored with the Bahn Mi sandwich. It was good, but I was expecting more based on the reviews. It did have a satisfying crunch. The beignets and jam were out of this world. I order you to get them.

Vietnamese food in a pretty French bistro.  Food: Tasty!!  Portion sizes: Good.  Coffee: European strong and served in a small glass.  Not a fan of the coffee but I would definitely come back for the food and airy atmosphere!

name: The Carillon
reviews: The food is amazing here but I will return because of the staff. Me and my partner booked a reservation through OpenTable and I made a note that it was our six year anniversary. The staff made and signed a card for us and we were greeted to a champagne toast. Everyone on the staff was incredibly attentive and every course of our meal was artfully crafted. We will definitely be returning.
Great food, great atmosphere, excellent service! Shout out to Oscar the manager for a great experience.

I go to this place  a lot! This is my favorite spot to eat.  I go there at least once a month. The cooking is fantastic, the crew is welcoming and the rates are good. I enjoy meeting in this restaurant to have a tasty supper.

Great to have such a cool bar/restaurant in town. Super selection of cocktails, wines, and beer. Not the largest selection of wines and beer - I think they have gone for quality rather than quantity, but the wines and beer I have tested were excellent. They even have a dry cider that my wife is happy about.

Celebrated our 9 years of marriage here. Staff was great and the food absolutely amazing! Would recommend to anyone! A definite must! They gave us free champagne for our anniversary and added a happy 9th anniversary to the menu. It was very sweet and appreciated. Will go back! Looking forward to it!

name: Loro
address: 2115 S Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78704, USA
reviews: What happens when a Asian restaurant and steakhouse have a love child?  Loro is what happens.  Interesting "self-service" kind of set up -- you order at the bar, and then they bring the food.  Service was excellent, and the food was unique.  I had salmon over rice with some Asian cabbage and other vegetables.  Seriously, I don't remember what they were, but it was all very, very good.  Probably better for a group and than date.

Delicious variety of food. My friend and I ordered several items to share. They are all small plates.  Everything was very tasty.  You order food at the bar, and serve your own beverages.  It was cold when we went but they do have nice outdoor space. Nice casual place. Would definitely go again.

This self proclaimed Asian smokehouse knows how to churn out quality dishes at a fast pace. Plenty of room for seating and also both in and outdoor options! The concept of ordering from the bar makes things pretty streamlined as well. I really love the corn fritters and the rice bowls. I notice the menu is getting new items added often too. Some of the meat serving sizes are a bit conservative, but overall, a must try place that is great to try for anybody looking for a culinary blend.

Had never been, was BLOWN away. I’m vegetarian and upon first glance thought I was screwed, but was shown several options from the menu which I ordered— the corn fritters, peppers and Tofu bowl. Each one is a standout choice! But that Tofu bowl, I mean what in the world is going on there??!! Sweet, sour, savory, crunchy, soft, tart, bright... it was a sensory explosion in my mouth! Very fast service, great iced teas, ample seating and fun atmosphere. I’ll definitely be back.

The Asian BBQ fusion created by Aaron Franklin and Tyson Cole was even better than I could have imagined. The explosive flavor, unique food and drink offerings, and refreshing atmosphere all contributed to the amazing experience. I was able to try the pork belly and brisket sandwich and both I would highly recommend. If you are looking for a one of a kind food experience in Austin, look no further than Loro!

name: Siena Restaurant
address: 6203 N Capital of Texas Hwy, Austin, TX 78731, USA
reviews: Handy hint: Please have reservations.  Pretty inside.  Good food. Yummy drink pairings.  Dessert is is hard if you have a nut allergy.  Beet salad was great...and the presentation of the beet salad was picturesque.  Handicap parking is in the back which I find sad. Included are pictures of the meal and menu.

My sisters and I took my daughter here for her birthday dinner. Our server was amazing, friendly, patient, polite. I know it's part of her job, but she was helpful in explaining the menu to us, check on us often, and made sure we were happy with everything. Her kind attitude made us feel welcomed and relaxed. We even stayed after they closed, and I was worried that we wouldn't have time for the cake. Our server and the entire staff never once mentioned that we need to leave. I was very surprised and impressed. Not only the food was fantastic, but the atmosphere was wonderful and of course our server was the best. Thank you for making us feel welcome, and memorable birthday for my daughter. This was our first time here. We would definitely come back.

My wife and I liked our experience overall. Most of the food was excellent and service was professional. We both felt that the crostini served with the Baked Brie were too thick and a bit over baked and difficult to enjoy. We look forward to returning and enjoying another quality meal in the near future.
I love this place! It’s a gem! I’m nowhere near it, but I enjoy the drive just for the food. That truffle butter is heaven. 🤤 Always ask for bread!

This is a great little Italian restaurant in Austin. The feel is old Italian, the food and service are excellent.  We had trout dish, our was cooked to perfection and the side of spinach was excellent as well. The Calamari appetizer was superb,  one odd there's dishes where you can't put you're fork down!

name: Eureka!
reviews:
The food was excellent. We ordered the truffle fries for appetizer, husband ordered the bison burger with sweet potato fries, and I got the veggie burger with fried mac & cheese balls. The whiskey sampler was great, although they were out of our top two choices. (It was a Monday, so I'm not terribly surprised.)

Service was so-so, only because we weren't checked on for about 10 minutes and needed water. Then asked, did not receive, asked again and it took a while... Servers were very friendly and helpful though, loved to make recommendations, and talked us into the bourbon barrel cake. (Oh. My. Goodness. Try it, you won't be disappointed!)

I usually order a burger here, but had the fish tacos last time for lunch which seemed a good choice to pair with the Mexican style lager. They were great - not as filling as the burgers, but still very satisfying. I've always favored this place as a solid go-to with a great beer and whiskey (or whisky) selection.

We stopped in after walking the entire block because their menu outside said they had craft beer. They didn't disappoint.  While I really only took pictures of the food the beer menu, both standard and rotating was quite great. The live music was good and our service was top notch!

The atmosphere was cool. Other than that, I’m not happy with my experience. 
I went in with a group of 3 people. We had poor service from the staff because they were to busy to give anyone attention. 
The waitress (black hair) had the time to ask me if I wanted sweet potato fries instead of regular fries with my burger, but when I asked for more - I was ignored. I paid $2.50 more for sweet potato fries and I got half of the amount of fries than everyone else. For perspective, I got about 10 small fries. My plate looked bare. 
I’m upset because I even asked another waitress (short with black hair), that assured me that I would get more. They never came.
The food was fine, but the staff ignored me. And when the kitchen neglected to give me enough fries, and the server didn’t care and brought me the food anyway, and when I asked for more I didn’t get them - that’s when I got upset.
They obviously care more about making a profit than making a customer satisfied.

Very good serving staff. Good no, excellent, food and bartenders were careful to let me know exactly what I was ordering. Made experience extra nice. Thanks guys. Good, not awesome, beer selection. Food was the thing for me.
